meta.copyright_long:
Publisher: Free Bible Software Group
Source: Riverside New Testament for e-Sword http://www.thechan.com/
Rights: The Riverside New Testament (1923), by William G. Ballantine, Boston: Houghton Mifflin Co.
The translation was made directly from the original Greek. Nestle's text was generally followed. However, he also used The Twentieth Century New Testament, Weymouth's New Testament in Modern Speech, Moffat's New Translation of the New Testament, the Revised Version, and the King James Version. Proper names were left as they were in the American Revised Version. It was written in paragraph form with no verse numbering, but with chapter numbers in Roman numerals.

sentences: 40 001 001	THE ancestral line of Jesus Christ , son of David , son of Abraham :
40 001 002	Abraham was the father of Isaac ; Isaac was the father of Jacob ; Jacob was the father of Judah and his brothers ;
40 001 003	Judah was the father of Perez and Zerah ; Perez was the father of Hezron ; Hezron was the father of Ram ;
40 001 004	Ram was the father of Amminadab ; Amminadab was the father of Nahshon ; Nahshon was the father of Salmon ;
40 001 005	Salmon was the father of Boaz ; Boaz was the father of Obed ;
40 001 006	Jesse was the father of David the King . David was the father of Solomon ;
40 001 007	Solomon was the father of Rehoboam ; Rehoboam was the father of Abijah ; Abijah was the father of Asa ;
40 001 008	Asa was the father of Jehoshaphat ; Jehoshaphat was the father of Joram ; Joram was the father of Uzziah ;
40 001 009	Uzziah was the father of Jotham ; Jotham was the father of Ahaz ; Ahaz was the father of Hezekiah ;
40 001 010	Hezekiah was the father of Manasseh ; Manasseh was the father of Amon ; Amon was the father of Josiah ;
40 001 011	Josiah was the father of Jechoniah and his brothers at the time of the Babylonian exile .
40 001 012	After the Babylonian exile , Jechoniah was the father of Shealtiel ; Shealtiel was the father of Zerubbabel ;
40 001 013	Zerubbabel was the father of Abiud ; Abiud was the father of Eliakim ; Eliakim was the father of Azor ;
40 001 014	Azor was the father of Sadoc ; Sadoc was the father of Achim ; Achim was the father of Eliud ;
40 001 015	Eliud was the father of Eleazar ; Eleazar was the father of Matthan ; Matthan was the father of Jacob ;
40 001 016	Jacob was the father of Joseph the husband of Mary , of whom was born Jesus , who is called Christ .

40 001 017	So there were in all fourteen generations from Abraham to David , and fourteen generations from David to the Babylonian exile , and fourteen generations from the Babylonian exile to the Christ .
40 001 018	The birth of Jesus was in this way : His mother Mary had been betrothed to Joseph , but before they came together she was found to be with child by the Holy Spirit .
40 001 019	Joseph , her husband , being an upright man , and yet not willing to make her a public example , resolved to dismiss her privately .

40 001 020	But while he was thinking this over , an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream and said , " Joseph , son of David , do not be afraid to take Mary as your wife , for what has been conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit .
40 001 021	She will bear a son and you shall call his name Jesus , for he will save his people from their sins . "
40 001 022	All this happened in fulfillment of what the Lord had spoken through the prophet :
40 001 023	" Behold the virgin will conceive and will bear a son , and they will call his name Immanuel " .
40 001 024	When Joseph awoke from sleep , he did as the angel of the Lord had bidden him , and took his wife to his home .
40 001 025	But he did not live with her as a husband until she had borne a son . He called his name Jesus .
40 002 001	AFTER Jesus had been born in Bethlehem , in Judaea , in the days of Herod the King , wise men from the East arrived at Jerusalem ,
40 002 002	saying , " Where is he who has been born King of the Jews ? For we saw his star in the East and have come to do homage to him . "
40 002 003	When King Herod heard it , he was disturbed , and so was all Jerusalem .
40 002 004	Then he called together all the high priests and scribes of the people and inquired of them where the Christ was to be born .
40 002 005	They said to him , " In Bethlehem , in Juda . For so it was written by the prophet ,
40 002 006	' And thou , Bethlehem , land of Judah , art by no means least among the leaders of Judah ; for from thee will come a leader who will shepherd my people Israel . ' "
40 002 007	Then Herod secretly summoned the wise men and learned from them exactly the time of the star's appearance ,
40 002 008	and as he sent them to Bethlehem he said , " Go and make careful inquiries about the child , and when you have found him bring me word , so that I too may come and do homage to him . "
40 002 009	After hearing the king , they journeyed on , and the star which they had seen in the East went before them until it came and stood over where the child was .
40 002 010	When they saw the star , they were very joyful .

40 002 011	They entered the house and saw the child with Mary his mother , and they fell down and did him homage . Then they opened their treasures and presented to him gifts , gold and frankincense and myrrh .
40 002 012	After this they were warned in a dream not to return to Herod , and so went by another mad back to their own country .

40 002 013	After they had gone , an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph and said , " Rise up , and take the child and his mother and flee into Egypt , and be there until I tell you , for Herod will search for the child in order to kill him . "
40 002 014	So Joseph rose up , and took the child and his mother in the night and went away to Egypt ,
40 002 015	and was there until the death of Herod , in order that the word of the Lord spoken through the prophet might be fulfilled , " Out of Egypt I called my Son . "

40 002 016	Then Herod , seeing that he had been outwitted by the wise men , became furious , and sent out and killed all the boy babies two years old and under in Bethlehem and all its neighborhood , guided by the date which he had carefully learned from the wise men .
40 002 017	Then was fulfilled what was spoken through Jeremiah the prophet when he said ,
40 002 018	" A voice was heard in Ramah , wailing and bitter lamentation , Rachel weeping for her children , and she would not be comforted because they are not . "
40 002 019	But after Herod had died , an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt
40 002 020	and said , " Arise , and take the child and his mother and go into the land of Israel , for they are dead who sought the child's life . "
40 002 021	So he arose , and took the child and his mother and came into the land of Israel .
40 002 022	But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judaea in place of his father Herod , he was afraid to go there , and being directed in a dream he went away to the region of Galilee
40 002 023	and settled in a town called Nazareth , so that what had been spoken through the prophets might be fulfilled , " He will be called a Nazarene . "
40 003 001	IN those days John the Baptist came preaching in the wild part of Judaea
40 003 002	and saying , " Repent ; for the kingdom of heaven is at hand .
40 003 003	For this is he who was foretold through Isaiah the prophet when he said : ' The voice of one crying aloud in the wilderness , Make ready the way of the Lord , make straight his paths . ' "
40 003 004	This John had his clothing of camel's hair and wore a leather belt around his waist , and his food was locusts and wild honey .
40 003 005	Then went out to him Jerusalem and all Judaea and all the neighborhood of the Jordan
40 003 006	and were baptized by him in the Jordan River , confessing their sins .
40 003 007	When he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming for baptism , he said , " Brood of vipers , who directed you to flee from the coming wrath ?
40 003 008	Produce fruit fitting for a change of heart ,
40 003 009	and do not think of saying to yourselves , ' We have Abraham for our father , ' for I tell you God is able out of these stones to raise up children for Abraham .
40 003 010	Now the axe is lying at the root of the trees . Every tree that does not yield good fruit will be cut down and cast into the fire .

40 003 011	I baptize you with water for a change of heart , but he who is coming after me is more powerful than I ; I am not worthy to carry his shoes ; he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire .
40 003 012	He has his fan in his hand and will thoroughly clean his threshing-floor . He will gather his grain into his storehouse , but the chaff he will burn with fire unquenchable . "
40 003 013	Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to John to be baptized by him .
40 003 014	But John opposed him , saying , " I have need to be baptized by you , and do you come to me ? "
40 003 015	Jesus replied , " Permit it now , for so it is fitting for us to complete every righteous act . " Then he permitted him .
40 003 016	Jesus , as soon as he was baptized , went up from the water , and the heavens were opened and he saw the Spirit of God descending as a dove and coming upon him .
40 003 017	A voice from the heavens said , " This is my Son , the beloved in whom I delight . "
40 004 001	THEN Jesus was led by the Spirit up into the wild country to be tempted by the Devil .
40 004 002	After he had fasted forty days and forty nights he was hungry .
40 004 003	Then the tempter came and said to him , " If you are the Son of God , tell these stones to turn into loaves of bread . "
40 004 004	But he answered , " It is written , ' Man shall not live on bread alone , but on every word that comes from the mouth of God . ' "
40 004 005	Then the Devil took him with him to the holy city and placed him on the top of the temple

40 004 006	and said to him , " If you are the Son of God , throw yourself down ; for it is written , ' To his angels he will give charge of you , and on their hands they will bear you lest you strike your foot against a stone . ' "
40 004 007	Jesus said to him , " It is written , too , ' Thou shalt not try the Lord thy God . ' "
40 004 008	Again the Devil took him with him to a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory ,
40 004 009	and said to him , " All these things I will give you if you will fall down and do homage to me . "
40 004 010	Jesus said to him , " Begone , Satan , for it is written , ' To the Lord thy God alone shalt thou do homage , and him alone shalt thou serve . ' "
40 004 011	Then the Devil left him , and angels came and waited upon him .
40 004 012	When Jesus heard that John had been betrayed , he went away into Galilee .
40 004 013	Leaving Nazareth , he came and lived in Capernaum on the lake shore on the borders of Zebulun and Naphtali ,
40 004 014	so that the word spoken by the prophet Isaiah might be fulfilled :
40 004 015	" Land of Zebulun and land of Naphtali , road to the sea , country beyond the Jordan , Galilee of the Gentiles ,
40 004 016	the people that sat in darkness saw a great light and upon those sitting in the land and shadow of death light dawned . "
40 004 017	From that time Jesus began to proclaim and say , " Repent , for the kingdom of heaven is at hand . "

40 004 018	As he was walking along the shore of the lake of Galilee , he saw two brothers , Simon who is called Peter , and Andrew his brother , casting a net into the lake , for they were fishermen ;
40 004 019	and he said to them , " Follow me and I will make you fishers of men . "
40 004 020	They at once left the nets and followed him .
40 004 021	Going on from there , he saw two other brothers — James the son of Zebedee and John his brother — in their boat with Zebedee their father , mending their nets ; and he called them .
40 004 022	They at once left the boat and their father and followed him .
40 004 023	Jesus went around through the whole of Galilee , teaching in the synagogues and proclaiming the good news of the Kingdom , and healing every disease and every infirmity among the people .

40 004 024	His fame spread out into all Syria , and they brought to him all who were sick with various diseases and those suffering from acute pain , demoniacs , lunatics , and paralytics , and he healed them .
40 004 025	Great crowds followed him from Galilee and Decapolis and Jerusalem and Judaea and from beyond the Jordan .
40 005 001	SEEING the crowds , he went up on the mountain , and when he had seated himself his disciples came to him .
40 005 002	He opened his mouth and taught them , saying :
40 005 003	" Blessed are the poor in spirit ! For theirs is the kingdom of heaven .
40 005 004	" Blessed are they that mourn ! For they will be comforted .
40 005 005	" Blessed are the gentle ! For they will inherit the land .
40 005 006	" Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness ! For they will have abundance .
40 005 007	" Blessed are the compassionate ! For they will receive compassion .
40 005 008	" Blessed are the pure in heart ! For they will see God .
40 005 009	" Blessed are the peacemakers ! For they will be called sons of God .
40 005 010	" Blessed are those who have been persecuted for righteousness ! For theirs is the kingdom of heaven .
40 005 011	" Blessed are you when men revile you and persecute you and say every evil thing against you falsely for my sake !
40 005 012	Rejoice and be exceedingly glad , for your reward is great in heaven . For so they persecuted the prophets who were before you .
40 005 013	" You are the salt of the earth . But if the salt becomes flat , with what can it be salted ? It is good for nothing but to be thrown out and trodden under foot by men .
40 005 014	You are the light of the world . A city cannot be hidden if set on a hill .
40 005 015	People do not light a lamp and put it under a peck-measure , but on the stand , and it gives light for all in the house .
40 005 016	So let your light shine before men that they may see your good works and give glory to your Father in heaven .
40 005 017	" Do not think that I have come to do away with the Law or the Prophets . I have not come to do away with them , but to fill them full .
40 005 018	I tell you truly , until heaven and earth pass away not the smallest letter or part of a letter will pass away from the Law , until all is done .

40 005 019	Whoever breaks one of these commandments , the least of them , and teaches men to do so , will be called least in the kingdom of heaven , and whoever does them and teaches them , he will be called great in the kingdom of heaven .
40 005 020	For I say to you that , unless your righteousness far exceeds that of the scribes and Pharisees , you will not enter into the kingdom of heaven .
40 005 021	" You have heard that it was said to the men of old , ' Thou shalt not commit murder . Whoever commits murder shall answer for it to the court . '
40 005 023	So then if you are bringing your gift to lay on the altar , and there you remember that your brother has something against you ,
40 005 024	leave your gift there before the altar and go , first be reconciled to your brother , and then come and offer your gift .

40 005 025	Get on good terms with your adversary quickly while you are on the road with him , for fear that he may deliver you to the judge and the judge may deliver you to the officer and you may be cast into prison .
40 005 026	Truly I tell you you will not come out until you pay the last penny . "
40 005 027	" You have heard that it was said , ' Thou shalt not commit adultery . '
40 005 028	But I say to you that every one who looks at a woman with lustful thoughts has already committed adultery with her in his heart .
40 005 029	If your right eye is a snare to you , pluck it out and cast it from you ; for it is better for you that one of your members should be lost and not your whole body be cast into Gehenna .
40 005 030	And if your right hand is a snare to you , cut it off and cast it from you . It is better for you that one of your members should be lost and not your whole body go into Gehenna .
40 005 031	" It was said , ' Whoever divorces his wife must give her a certificate of divorce . '
40 005 032	But I say to you that every one who divorces his wife , unless for the cause of unchastity , makes her commit adultery , and whoever marries a divorced woman commits adultery .
40 005 033	" Again , you have heard that it was said to the men of old , ' Thou shalt not swear falsely , but shalt perform to the Lord thine oaths . '
40 005 034	But I tell you not to swear at all ; neither by heaven , because it is God's throne ;
40 005 035	nor by the earth , because it is his footstool ; nor by Jerusalem , because it is the city of the Great King ;
40 005 036	nor must you swear by your head , for you cannot make one hair white or black .
40 005 037	But let your yes be yes and your no be no . Whatever is more than these is from evil .
40 005 038	" You have heard that it was said , ' An eye for an eye and a tooth for a tooth . '
40 005 039	But I tell you not to resist a wicked man , but if any one strikes you on the right cheek , turn to him also the other ;
40 005 040	and if any one is determined to sue you for your tunic , let him have your cloak too ;
40 005 041	and if any one commandeers you for a mile , go with him two .
40 005 042	To him who begs , give ; from him who wishes to borrow of you , do not turn away .
40 005 043	" You have heard that it was said , ' Thou shalt love thy neighbor and hate thine enemy . '
40 005 044	But I say to you , Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you ,
40 005 045	that you may be sons of your Father in heaven ; for he makes his sun to rise upon the bad and the good , and sends rain upon the just and the unjust .
40 005 046	For if you love those who love you , what reward have you ? Do not also the tax collectors do the same thing ?
40 005 047	And if you salute your brothers only , what superiority have you ? Do not the Gentiles do the same ?
40 005 048	You must be perfect as your heavenly Father is perfect .
40 006 001	" BE careful not to do your religious actions before men in order to be seen by them . Otherwise you have no reward from your Father in heaven .

40 006 002	When you give gifts of mercy , do not sound a trumpet before you as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets , in order that they may be honored by men . I assure you they get their payment in full .
40 006 003	But you , when you are giving a gift of mercy , must not let your left hand know what your right hand is doing ,
40 006 004	so that your gift may be in secret , and your Father , who sees in secret , will repay you .

40 006 005	" When you pray , you must not be like the hypocrites , for they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and on the street corners so as to be seen by men . I assure you they get their payment in full .
40 006 006	But you , when you pray , go into your inner room and shut your door and pray to your Father who is in secret , and your Father , who sees in secret , will reward you .
40 006 007	" When praying do not keep repeating , as the Gentiles do , for they think that they will be heard because of their multitude of words .
40 006 008	Do not be like them , for your Father knows what you have need of before you ask him .
40 006 009	Pray in this way : ' Our Father in heaven , Thy name be kept holy ;
40 006 010	Thy kingdom come ; Thy will prevail ; As in heaven , so on earth .
40 006 011	Our bread for the coming day Give us to-day ;
40 006 012	And forgive us our failures As we forgive those who fail toward us ;
40 006 013	And bring us not into trial , But save us from evil . '
40 006 014	For if you forgive men their wrongdoings , your heavenly Father will also forgive you ;
40 006 015	but if you do not forgive men , neither will your Father forgive you your wrongdoings .
40 006 016	" When you fast , do not wear gloomy faces as hypocrites do . For they disfigure their faces so as to be seen by men to be fasting . I assure you they get their payment in full .
40 006 017	But you , when fasting , anoint your head and wash your face ,
40 006 018	so as not to appear to men to be fasting , but to your Father who is in secret , and your Father , who sees in secret , will reward you .
40 006 019	" Do not lay up for yourselves treasures on the earth , where moth and rust corrode and where thieves break in and steal .
40 006 020	But lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven , where neither moth nor rust corrodes and where thieves do not break in nor steal .
40 006 021	For where your treasure is there will your heart be also .
40 006 022	" The lamp of the body is the eye . If your eye is clear your whole body will be lighted up ,
40 006 023	but if your eye is bad your whole body will be darkened . If the light that is in you is darkness , how great the darkness is !
40 006 024	No one can serve two masters . For either he will hate one and love the other or he will hold to one and despise the other . You cannot serve God and Mammon .

40 006 025	" Therefore I tell you , do not be anxious about your physical life — what you are to eat or what you are to drink ; nor about your body — what you are to wear . Is not the life more than the food and the body more than the clothing ?
40 006 026	Look at the birds of the air . They do not sow nor reap nor gather into barns , but your heavenly Father feeds them . Are you not of more value than they ?
40 006 027	But who of you by being anxious can add to his height one foot ?
40 006 028	And why are you anxious about clothing ? Consider the lilies of the field , bow they grow . They neither toil nor spin .
40 006 029	But I tell you that not even Solomon in all his splendor was arrayed like one of these .
40 006 030	If God so clothes the herbage of the field , to-day growing and to-morrow thrown into the oven , will he not much more clothe you , O you of so little faith ?
40 006 031	So do not be anxious , saying , What are we to eat ? or , What are we to drink ? or , What are we to wear ?
40 006 032	For all these things the pagans seek after . For your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things .
40 006 033	But you must seek first his kingdom and his righteousness , and all these things will be supplied to you .
40 006 034	Do not be anxious about to-morrow , for to-morrow will take care of itself . Enough for the day is its own trouble .
40 007 001	" DO not judge , so that you may not be judged .
40 007 002	For with whatever judgment you judge you will be judged , and with whatever measure you measure you will be measured .
40 007 003	Why do you look at the speck that is in your brother's eye , while you do not perceive the beam in your own eye ?
40 007 004	Or how will you say to your brother , ' Let me get out the speck from your eye , ' when there is a beam in your own eye ?
40 007 005	You hypocrite , first get the beam out of your own eye , and then you will see clearly to get the speck out of your brother's eye .
40 007 006	" Do not give what is holy to the dogs , nor east your pearls before swine , for they may trample them under their feet and turn and tear you .
40 007 007	" Ask and it will be given to you ; seek and you will find ; knock and the door will be opened .
40 007 008	For every one who asks obtains , and he who seeks finds , and to him who knocks the door is opened .
40 007 009	Is there any man of you who if his son asks him for bread will give him a stone ?
40 007 010	Or if he asks for a fish will give him a serpent ?
40 007 011	If you , though evil , know how to give good gifts to your children , how much more will your heavenly Father give good things to those who ask him .
40 007 012	" All things that you wish men to do for you , do yourselves for them ; for this is the Law and the Prophets .
40 007 013	" Enter through the narrow gate . For wide and spacious is the road that leads away to ruin , and many there are who go through it ;
40 007 014	but narrow is the gate and contracted is the road that leads into life , and few there are who find it .
40 007 015	" Beware of false prophets , such as come to you in the clothing of sheep , but inwardly are ravenous wolves .
40 007 016	From their fruits you will know them . Are grapes gathered from thorns or figs from thistles ?
40 007 017	Just so every good tree yields fine fruit , but a worthless tree yields bad fruit .
40 007 018	It is not possible for a good tree to yield had fruit nor for a worthless tree to yield fine fruit .
40 007 019	Every tree that does not yield fine fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire .
40 007 020	So then , from their fruits you will know them .
40 007 021	" Not every one who says to me , ' Master , Master , ' will enter into the kingdom of heaven , but he who does the will of my Father who is in heaven .
40 007 022	Many will say to me on that day , ' Master , Master , did we not prophesy in your name , and in your name east out demons , and in your name do many miracles ? '
40 007 023	And then I will tell them plainly , ' I never knew you . Depart from me , you who work lawlessness . '
40 007 024	" Every one , therefore , who hears these words of mine and does them will be like a wise man who built his house upon the rock ;
40 007 025	and the rain descended and the rivers rose and the winds blew , and they beat upon that house ; but it fell not , for it had been founded on the rock .
40 007 026	And every one who hears these words of mine and does not do them will be like a foolish man who built his house upon the sand .
40 007 027	And the rain descended and the rivers rose and the winds blew , and they struck upon that house and it fell , and great was the ruin of it . "
40 007 028	When Jesus ended these words , the crowds were astonished at his teaching .
40 007 029	For he taught them like one who had authority , and not as their scribes taught .
40 008 001	WHEN Jesus had come down from the mountain , great crowds followed him .
40 008 002	And a leper came up and bowed before him , and said , " Sir , if you have the will , you have power to make me clean . "
40 008 003	Jesus stretched out his hand and touched him and said , " I have the will , be cleansed . " Instantly his leprosy was cleansed away .
40 008 004	Jesus said to him , " Be sure and do not say a word to any one , but go and show yourself to the priest and offer the gift which Moses prescribed as evidence for them . "
40 008 005	When Jesus had entered Capernaum there came to him a Centurion who implored his help .
40 008 006	" Sir , " he said , " my servant lies in my house a paralytic , in great distress . "
40 008 007	Jesus said to him , " I will come and heal him . "
40 008 008	The Centurion answered , " Sir , I am not worthy to have you come under my roof ; but just speak the word and my servant will be cured .

40 008 009	For I am a man , — under authority , — with soldiers under me , and I say to this one , ' Go , ' and he goes , and to another , ' Come , ' and he comes , and to my slave , ' Do this , ' and he does it . "
40 008 010	When Jesus heard this , he was astonished and said , " Truly I tell you , I have not found so great faith on the part of any one in Israel .
40 008 011	I tell you many will come from the east and from the west and will recline at table with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven .
40 008 012	But the sons of the kingdom will be cast out into the darkness outside . There will be wailing and gnashing of teeth . "
40 008 013	Then Jesus said to the Centurion , " Go . As you have believed , so be it to you . " His servant was healed that very hour .
40 008 014	When Jesus entered the house of Peter , he saw his wife's mother lying sick with fever .
40 008 015	He touched her hand and the fever left her . Then she arose and waited upon him .
40 008 016	When evening came , they brought to him many demoniacs and he cast out the spirits by a word , and all their sick he healed .
40 008 017	This was in order to fulfill what was spoken through Isaiah the prophet , " He took our weaknesses and bore away our diseases . "
40 008 018	When Jesus saw a crowd around him , he gave directions to go over to the other side of the lake .
40 008 019	Then a certain scribe came to him and said , " Teacher , I will follow you wherever you go . "
40 008 020	Jesus said to him , " The foxes have holes and the birds of the air have coverts , but the Son of Man has not where to lay his head . "
40 008 021	Another of his disciples said to him , " Sir , let me first go and bury my father . "
40 008 022	But Jesus said to him , " Follow me , and let the dead bury their own dead . "
40 008 023	Then he got into the boat and his disciples followed him .
40 008 024	Soon a great storm broke on the lake so that the boat was hidden under the waves ; but he was sleeping .
40 008 025	His disciples came to him and woke him and said , " Master , save us . We are going down . "
