45 016 009	Give my greetings to Urbanus our fellow worker in Christ , and to Stachys my beloved .
45 016 010	Give my greetings to Apelles , that tested man in Christ . Give my greetings to the household of Aristobulus .
45 016 011	Give my greetings to Herodion , who is of my race . Give my greetings to those of the household of Narcissus who are in the Lord .
45 016 012	Give my greetings to Tryphaena and Tryphosa , those workers in the Lord . Give my greetings to Persis the beloved , who has worked hard in the Lord .
45 016 013	Give my greetings to Rufus the chosen in the Lord , and to his mother and mine .
45 016 014	Give my greetings to Asyncritus , Phlegon , Hermes , Petrobas , Hermas , and the brethren with them .
45 016 015	Give my greetings to Philologus , and Julia , Nereus and his sister , and Olympas , and all the holy with them .
45 016 016	Give my greetings to one another with a holy kiss . All the churches of Christ send their greetings to you .
45 016 017	I beg you , brethren , to keep your eye on those who are making divisions and occasions for sin contrary to the teaching which you have learned , and to shun them .
45 016 018	For such persons are not serving our Lord Christ , but their own stomachs , and by their smooth and pleasing talk they mislead the hearts of the innocent .
45 016 019	For your obedience has come to the knowledge of all men . Therefore I rejoice over you , but I wish you to be wise regarding what is good , and simple in regard to what is evil .
45 016 020	The God of peace will crush Satan under your feet shortly . The grace of our Lord Jesus be with you !
45 016 021	Timothy , my fellow worker , sends his greeting , and so do Lucius and Jason and Sosipater , who are of my race .
45 016 022	I , Tertius , who penned this letter , greet you in the Lord .
45 016 023	Gaius , my host and the host of the whole church , sends his greetings . Erastus the city treasurer sends his greetings , and so does Quartus the brother .

45 016 025	To him who is able to make you strong according to the good news which I bear , and the proclamation of Jesus Christ , and according to the revelation of the mystery kept secret through ages ,
45 016 026	but now made manifest through the prophetic Scriptures by the command of the eternal God , to promote obedience to the faith made known to all the Gentiles —
45 016 027	to God , the only wise , be glory through Jesus Christ for the ages of the ages !
46 001 001	PAUL called by the will of God to be an apostle of Christ Jesus , and Sosthenes our brother ,
46 001 002	to the Church of God in Corinth , made holy in Christ Jesus , called to be holy , with all everywhere who call upon the name of our Lord Jesus Christ , their Lord and ours :
46 001 003	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ !
46 001 004	I am always thanking God for you because of the grace of God given to you in Christ Jesus ,
46 001 005	that you are rich in him in everything , in readiness of speech and in all knowledge ,
46 001 006	so that my testimony to Christ has been confirmed among you
46 001 007	and so that you are not lacking in any gift while waiting for our Lord Jesus Christ to be revealed .
46 001 008	He will keep you strong to the end and free from reproach on the day of our Lord Jesus Christ .
46 001 009	God is faithful , and it is by him that you have been called into the fellowship of his Son , Jesus Christ our Lord .
46 001 010	I beg you , brethren , in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ , all to say the same thing and not to have divisions among you , but to be united in the same mind and in the same opinion .
46 001 011	For it has been told me regarding you , brethren , by Chloe's people , that there are dissensions among you .
46 001 012	I mean that each of you is saying , " I belong to Paul , " " I belong to Apollos , " " I belong to Cephas , " or , " I belong to Christ . "
46 001 013	Has Christ been divided ? Was Paul crucified for you ? Or were you baptized in the name of Paul ?
46 001 014	I am thankful that I baptized no one of you except Crispus and Gaius ,
46 001 015	so that no one can say that you were baptized in my name .
46 001 016	I baptized also the household of Stephanas . Beyond that I do not know that I baptized any one else .
46 001 017	For Christ did not send me to baptize , but to proclaim the good news — not in wisdom of words , that the cross of Christ might not be emptied of meaning .
46 001 018	For the message of the cross is foolishness to those who are perishing , but to us who are being saved it is the power of God .
46 001 019	For it is written , " I will destroy the wisdom of the wise and I will bring to nought the prudence of the prudent . "
46 001 020	Where is the wise ? Where is the scribe ? Where is the debater of this world ? Has not God made foolish the wisdom of the world ?
46 001 021	For when in the wisdom of God the world by its wisdom did not come to know God , God was pleased to save through the foolishness of our proclamation those who believe .
46 001 022	Jews ask for signs and Greeks seek for wisdom ,
46 001 023	but we proclaim Christ crucified , to Jews a stumbling block , to Gentiles folly ,
46 001 024	but to those who are called , whether Jews or Greeks , Christ , the power of God and the wisdom of God .
46 001 025	For God's foolishness is wiser than men and God's weakness is stronger than men .
46 001 026	Consider your own call , brethren , that not many wise , humanly speaking , not many powerful , not many high-born have been called .
46 001 027	But God has chosen the foolish things of the world to put to shame the wise , and God has chosen the weak things of the world to put to shame the strong ,
46 001 028	and God has chosen the low-born things and the things of no account , the things that are not , to defeat the things that are ,
46 001 029	that no human being may boast in God's presence .
46 001 030	By God's act you are in Christ Jesus , who has become to us wisdom from God and righteousness and holiness and deliverance ,
46 001 031	so that , as it is written , " Let him who boasts boast in the Lord . "
46 002 001	AND I in coming to you , brethren , did not come with superiority of speech or of wisdom , announcing to you the testimony of God .
46 002 002	For I determined to know nothing among you but Jesus Christ — and him crucified .
46 002 003	And I came to you in weakness and in fear and in much trembling ,
46 002 004	and my speech and my proclamation were not in persuasive words of wisdom , but with spiritual and powerful proof ,
46 002 005	that your faith might not depend on the wisdom of man but on the power of God .
46 002 006	We do speak wisdom among the mature , but a wisdom not of this world nor of the defeated rulers of this world .
46 002 007	But we speak a wisdom of God in a mystery , the hidden wisdom which God predestined before the world began for our glory .
46 002 008	None of the rulers of this world knew it , for if they had known it they would not have crucified the Lord of glory .
46 002 009	But as it is written , " What eye has not seen and what ear has not heard and what has not entered human mind , God has prepared for those who love him . "
46 002 010	To us God has revealed this by his Spirit . For the Spirit searches all things , even the depths of God .
46 002 011	For who of men knows what pertains to a man except the spirit of the man which is in him . Just so no one knows what pertains to God except the Spirit of God .
46 002 012	But we did not receive the spirit of the world , but the Spirit that is from God , so that we know the gracious gifts of God .
46 002 013	And these we speak of , not in words taught by man's wisdom , but in words taught by the Spirit , expressing spiritual things in spiritual words .
46 002 014	But the animal man does not receive the things of the Spirit of God , for they are foolishness to him , nor can he know them because they are spiritually understood .
46 002 015	But the spiritual man understands all things though he himself is understood by no one .
46 002 016	For " Who has known the mind of the Lord ? Who will teach him ? " But we have the mind of Christ .
46 003 001	AND I myself , brethren , could not speak to you as spiritual , but as fleshly , as babes in Christ .
46 003 002	I fed you with milk , not solid food . For you were not able to take it . Nor are you yet able , for you are still fleshly .
46 003 003	For while there is jealousy and strife among you , are you not fleshly and living in man's way ?
46 003 004	For when one says , " I belong to Paul , " and another , " I belong to Apollos , " are you not men ?
46 003 005	What then is Apollos ? What is Paul ? Servants through whom you were led to faith , as the Lord granted to each of us .
46 003 006	I planted , Apollos watered , but God made the seed grow .
46 003 007	So then neither is he who planted anything nor he who watered , but God who makes the seed grow .
46 003 008	Each will receive his own reward according to his own labor .
46 003 009	We are God's fellow workers : you are God's farm God's building .
46 003 010	According to the grace of God granted to me , as a wise master-builder I have laid a foundation and another is building on it . But let each be careful how he builds on it .
46 003 011	For no one can lay any other foundation than that which has been laid , which is Jesus Christ .
46 003 012	If any one builds on this foundation gold , silver , costly stones , wood , hay , straw —
46 003 013	every one's work will become manifest . For the day will show it , because it will be revealed in fire and the fire will test each one's work , of what quality it is .
46 003 014	If the work which any one has built stands he will get a reward .
46 003 015	If any one's work burns up he will suffer loss , though he himself will be saved , but as through fire .
46 003 016	Do you not know that you are God's temple and the Spirit of God dwells in you ?
46 003 017	If any one mars the temple of God , God will mar him , for the temple of God is holy , and you are the temple .
46 003 018	Let no one deceive himself . If any one of you thinks himself wise in this world , let him become a fool in order to become wise .
46 003 019	For the wisdom of this world is foolishness in God's sight . For it is written , " He catches the wise in their own craftiness , "
46 003 020	and again , " The Lord knows the reasonings of the wise to be futile . "
46 003 021	Therefore let no one boast in men . For all things are yours —
46 003 022	Paul or Apollos or Cephas or the world or life or death or things present or things to come — all are yours
46 003 023	and you are Christ's and Christ is God's .
46 004 001	LET a man view us as servants of Christ and stewards of God's mysteries .
46 004 002	Moreover , in the case of stewards it is required that a man be found faithful .
46 004 003	But it is of very slight importance to me to be judged by you or any human court . I do not even pass judgment on myself .
46 004 004	For I am not conscious of any wrong , but I am not proved by that to be faultless . The Lord is my judge .

46 004 005	So do not judge anything before the time , before the Lord comes . He will throw light on the hidden things of darkness and will make manifest the purposes of hearts . Then each one will have his praise from God .

46 004 006	All this , brethren , I have applied to myself and Apollos for your sake , that you may learn the maxim , " Nothing beyond what is written , " and may not be puffed up in partisanship for one against the other .
46 004 007	For who gives you superiority ? What have you that you did not receive ? Why are you boasting as if you had not received it ?
46 004 008	You are already fully satisfied . You have already become rich . You have become kings without us . Would that you had become kings so that we might be kings with you !
46 004 009	For it seems to me that God has set us apostles out last of all as men doomed to death , that we may be a spectacle to the world and to angels and to men .
46 004 010	We are fools for Christ's sake , but you are wise in Christ ; we are weak , but you are strong ; you have glory , but we are despised .
46 004 011	Up to this present hour we are hungry and thirsty and naked and beaten . We wander about
46 004 012	and labor , working with our own hands . When abused we bless , when persecuted we endure it ,
46 004 013	when slandered we entreat . We have come to be , as it were , the sweepings of the world , the riffraff of all things up to now .
46 004 014	I am not writing this to shame you , but to warn you as my beloved children .
46 004 015	For if you have ten thousand teachers in Christ , still you have not many fathers . For I was your father in Christ Jesus through the good news .
46 004 016	So I beg you to be imitators of me .
46 004 017	For this very purpose I have sent to you Timothy , who is my loved and faithful child in the Lord . He will remind you of my ways in Christ — how I teach everywhere in every church .
46 004 018	Some persons have become puffed up , thinking that I am not coming to you .
46 004 019	But I shall come to you shortly , if the Lord wills , and I will find out , not the talk of these puffed-up ones , but their power .
46 004 020	For the kingdom of God is not in talk , but in power .
46 004 021	Which do you wish ? Shall I come with a rod or in love and a spirit of gentleness ?
46 005 001	IT is generally reported that there is unchastity among you , and such unchastity as is not even among the Gentiles , so that a man has his father's wife !
46 005 002	And you are puffed up with pride and have not rather grieved and taken steps to expel from among you the doer of this deed !
46 005 003	For I , absent in body , but present in spirit , have already as if I were present judged the man who has acted thus .
46 005 004	When you assembled in the name of the Lord Jesus and my spirit was also present with the power of our Lord Jesus ,
46 005 005	I decided to deliver over such a one to Satan for the destruction of the flesh , that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord .
46 005 006	Your boasting is unbecoming . Do you not know that a little yeast sets the whole mass fermenting ?
46 005 007	Cleanse out the old yeast that you may be new dough , free from yeast , as indeed you are . For Christ , our Passover , has been sacrificed .
46 005 008	So let us keep the festival , not with the old yeast nor with the yeast of evil and wickedness , but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth .
46 005 009	I wrote to you in my letter not to associate with unchaste people ,
46 005 010	certainly not meaning the unchaste of this world , or the covetous or extortionate or idolaters , since in that case you would have to leave the world .

46 005 011	But now I write to you not to associate with any one who is called a brother , if he is unchaste or covetous or idolatrous or abusive or drunken or extortionate — not even to eat with such a one .
46 005 012	For what business of mine is it to judge outsiders ? Is it not for you to judge those inside ?
46 005 013	But outsiders God will judge . Expel the wicked man from among yourselves .
46 006 001	DOES any one of you , if he has a grievance against another , dare to bring the case before the unrighteous and not before the holy ?
46 006 002	Do you not know that the holy are going to judge the world ? If the world is to be judged by you , are you unfit for the most trivial cases ?
46 006 003	Do you not know that we are to judge angels , to say nothing of affairs of this life ?
46 006 004	If then you have affairs of this life , do you ask men who in the view of the church count for nothing to sit as judges ?
46 006 005	I say this to your shame . Is it true that there is among you no one wise enough to judge between a man and his brother ,
46 006 006	but brother goes to law with brother and that before unbelievers ?
46 006 007	Now this is an utter failure on your part that you have lawsuits with one another . Why not rather let yourselves be wronged ? Why not rather be defrauded ?
46 006 008	But you yourselves practice wrongs and frauds — and that upon your brethren .

46 006 009	Do you not know that unrighteous people will not inherit the kingdom of God ? Make no mistake , neither the unchaste , nor idolaters , nor adulterers , nor those who practice unnatural vices ,
46 006 010	nor thieves , nor the avaricious , nor drunkards , nor the abusive , nor extortioners will inherit the kingdom of God .

46 006 011	And such some of you were . But you have washed yourselves ; but you have been made holy ; but you have been pronounced righteous in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ and in the Spirit of our God .
46 006 012	All things are lawful for me , but not everything is beneficial . All things are lawful , but I will not be overpowered by anything .

46 006 013	Food of all kinds is for the stomach and the stomach for foods . But God will end the function of one and the other . The body is not for unchastity , but for the Lord , and the Lord is for the body .
46 006 014	God raised the Lord and will also raise us through his power .
46 006 015	Do you not know that your bodies are members of Christ ? Shall I then take the members of Christ and make them members of a prostitute ? Never !
46 006 016	Do you not know that he who unites himself to a prostitute is one body with her ? For God says , " The two shall become one flesh . "
46 006 017	He who is united to the Lord is one spirit .
46 006 018	Shun unchastity . Every other sin that a man does is apart from the body , but the unchaste sins against his own body .
46 006 019	Do you not know that your body is the temple of the Holy Spirit within you , which you have from God , and that you are not your own ?
46 006 020	For you were bought with a price . Glorify God then in your bodies .
46 007 001	WITH reference to the matters you wrote of : It is an excellent thing for a man not to touch a woman .
46 007 002	But because of the prevailing unchastity , let each man have his own wife and each woman her own husband .
46 007 003	Let the husband pay his wife conjugal dues and the wife her husband .
46 007 004	The wife has not power over her own body , but her husband has . In the same way the husband has not power over his own body , but his wife has .

46 007 005	Do not deprive one another , unless by agreement for a time , that you may have freedom for prayer , and again come together . You must not let Satan tempt you through your lack of self-control .
46 007 006	I say this by way of indulgence , not by way of command .
46 007 007	I wish that every one were just as I am . But each has his own gift from God , one in one way and one in another .
46 007 008	I say to the unmarried and the widows , it is excellent for them to remain as I do .
46 007 009	But if they lack self-control , let them marry . It is better to marry than to burn .
46 007 010	To the married I command — yet not I , but the Lord — that the wife is not to leave her husband
46 007 011	and the husband is not to put away his wife .
46 007 012	To the rest I say — not the Lord : If any brother has a wife who is an unbeliever and she is pleased to live with him , let him not put her away .
46 007 013	And if any woman has a husband who is an unbeliever and he is pleased to live with her , let her not put him away .
46 007 014	For the unbelieving husband has been made holy by the wife and the unbelieving wife has been made holy by the husband . Otherwise your children would be impure , but now they are holy .
46 007 015	But if the unbelieving one actually leaves , let him leave . The brother or sister is not under bondage in such cases ; but God has called you to peace .
46 007 016	For how do you know , O wife , whether you will save your husband ? Or how do you know , O husband , whether you will save your wife ?
46 007 017	But , as the Lord has allotted to each , let each go on living as when God called him . So I prescribe in all the churches .
46 007 018	Was any one already circumcised when called ? Let him not efface it . Was any one called when uncircumcised ? Let him not become circumcised .
46 007 019	Circumcision is nothing and uncircumcision is nothing , but the keeping of the commandments of God is all .
46 007 020	Let each stay in that condition in which he was called .
46 007 021	Were you called when a slave ? Let it not trouble you . On the contrary , even if you can become free , take it in preference .
46 007 022	For the slave who has been called in the Lord is the Lord's freedman . Just so the free man , when called , is the slave of Christ .
46 007 023	You were bought with a price . Do not become slaves of men .
46 007 024	Let each one , brethren , stay in that condition in which he was called , close to God .
46 007 025	In regard to unmarried women I have no command of the Lord , but I give my opinion as one who through the mercy of the Lord is trustworthy .
46 007 026	I think then that this is an excellent thing on account of the present distress — that it is an excellent thing for a person to be unmarried .
46 007 027	Have you been bound to a wife ? Seek not release . Have you been freed from a wife ? Do not seek a wife .
46 007 028	But even if you marry , you have not sinned . Even if a maiden marries , she has not sinned . But such will have trouble in the flesh , and I would spare you .
46 007 029	But this I say , brethren : The time is shortened . For what remains let those who have wives be as if they had none ,
46 007 030	and those who weep as if they wept not , and those who rejoice as if they rejoiced not , and those who buy as if they possessed nothing ,
46 007 031	and those who use the world as if not overusing it . For the present order of this world is passing away .
46 007 032	I wish you to be free from worry . The unmarried man is anxious about the things of the Lord — how be may please the Lord .
46 007 033	The married man is anxious about the things of the world — how he may please his wife ,

46 007 034	and his interest is divided . So the unmarried woman or the maiden is anxious about the things of the Lord , that she may be holy in body and spirit . But the married woman is anxious about the things of the world — how she may please her husband .
46 007 035	This I say for your benefit , not to throw a noose over you , but to promote decorum and constant devotion to the Lord without distraction .
46 007 036	If any one thinks that he is acting unbecomingly toward his virgin , if she is ripe for marriage and there is need , let him do what he will . He does not sin . Let them marry .
46 007 037	He who stands firm in his heart , having no necessity , and has power over his own will and has decided in his heart to keep his virgin , will do well .
46 007 038	So he who marries his virgin does well , and he who does not marry her will do better .
46 007 039	A woman is bound as long as her husband is living . But if her husband falls asleep , she is free to marry whom she will , though only in the Lord .
46 007 040	But in my opinion she is happier if she stays as she is . And I think that I have the Spirit of God .
46 008 001	NOW as to things that have been sacrificed to idols , we know that we all have knowledge . Knowledge puffs up , but love builds up .
46 008 002	If any one think ; that he knows anything , he does not yet know as he ought to know .
46 008 003	If any one loves God , he is known by him .
46 008 004	Regarding the eating of things that have been sacrificed to idols , then , we know that an idol is nothing in the world , and that there is no God but one .
46 008 005	And though there are so-called gods in heaven and on earth , for there are gods many and lords many ,
46 008 006	still to us there is one God the Father , of whom are all things and we for him , and one Lord , Jesus Christ , through whom are all things and we through him .
46 008 007	But all have not this knowledge . Some , having been accustomed to idols up to the present time , eat the food as a sacrifice to an idol , and their conscience being weak is stained .
46 008 008	But food does not bring us near to God , for neither do we lose by not eating nor gain by eating .
46 008 009	But be careful that this power of yours may not become a stumbling block to the weak .

46 008 010	For if any one sees you who have knowledge reclining at table in an idol's temple , will not the conscience of that weak one be emboldened to eat things that have been sacrificed to idols ?
46 008 011	Thus the weak man is ruined by your knowledge — the brother for whom Christ died .
46 008 012	So sinning against the brethren and wounding their weak consciences you sin against Christ .
46 008 013	Therefore if food makes my brother stumble I will not eat meat while the world stands , for fear of making my brother stumble .
46 009 001	AM I not free ? Am I not an apostle ? Have I not seen Jesus our Lord ? Are you not my work in the Lord ?
46 009 002	If to others I am not an apostle , certainly I am to you . For you are the seal of my apostleship in the Lord .
46 009 003	My defence to those who criticize me is this :
46 009 004	Have we not the right to eat and drink ?
46 009 005	Have we not the right to take about with us a sister as wife , as the rest of the apostles do and the brothers of the Lord and Cephas ?
46 009 006	Or am I only , and Barnabas , without the right not to do manual labor ?

46 009 007	Who ever serves as a soldier and supplies his own pay and rations ? Who plants a vineyard and does not eat the fruit of it ? Who keeps a flock and does not drink any of the milk of the flock ?
46 009 008	Am I saying these things from a man's point of view or does not the Law also say them ?
46 009 009	For in the Law of Moses it is written , " You shall not muzzle an ox when he is treading out grain . " Is God thinking of the oxen ?
46 009 010	or does he say this wholly for our sakes ? For our sakes ; for it was written because the plowman ought to plow in hope and the thresher ought to thresh in hope of having a share .
46 009 011	If we sowed for you things of the spirit , is it a great matter if we reap your things of the flesh ?
46 009 012	If others share this right over you , do not we still more ? But we have not used this right . No , we endure all things in order not to cause any hindrance to the good news of Christ .
46 009 013	Do you not know that those who do the work of the Temple eat the things that come from the Temple , and those who minister at the altar share with the altar ?
46 009 014	So the Lord has directed that those who proclaim the good news shall have their living from the good news .
46 009 015	But I have used none of these rights and I am not writing this in order that it may be done in my case . For it would be better for me to die — No one shall make my boast an empty one !
46 009 016	For although I tell the good news I have nothing to boast of . For a necessity is laid upon me . Alas for me if I do not tell the good news !
46 009 017	If I do it voluntarily I have a reward , but if reluctantly , I have been charged with a responsibility .
46 009 018	What then is my reward ? That in telling the good news I make the good news free , and do not take full advantage of my rights in the good news .
46 009 019	For though I am free from all I have enslaved myself to all that I may gain the more .
46 009 020	I became to the Jews a Jew , to gain the Jews ; to those under law as under law , though not myself under law , to gain those who are under law .
46 009 021	To those without law , I became as without law , though not without the law of God and under the law of Christ , to gain those who are without law .
46 009 022	To the weak I became weak to gain the weak . To all men I became all things in order by all means to save some .
46 009 023	I do all things for the sake of the good news that I may become a partner with it .
46 009 024	Do you not know that those who run in a stadium all run , yet one gets the prize ? Run so as to win .
46 009 025	Every one who contends in the games practices self-restraint in all things . They do it to win a fading crown , but we for an unfading one .
46 009 026	Thus I run with no uncertain goal : thus I strike , not as if pounding the air .
46 009 027	On the contrary , I maul and master my body so that I may not , after preaching to others , become myself unable to stand the test .
46 010 001	I DO not wish you to be ignorant , brethren , that our fathers were all under the cloud and all passed through the sea
46 010 002	and all received baptism in the cloud and in the sea ,
46 010 003	and all ate the same spiritual food
46 010 004	and all drank the same spiritual drink . For they drank from a spiritual rock that followed them , and the rock was Christ .
46 010 005	But with the most of them God was not well pleased . For they were strewn in the desert .
46 010 006	These things happened as warnings for us , that we may not be eager for evil things as they were eager .
46 010 007	Be not idolaters , as some of them were , as it is written , " The people sat down to eat and drink and rose up to dance . "
46 010 008	Nor let us be unchaste , as some of them were and twenty-three thousand fell dead in one day .
46 010 009	Nor let us try the patience of the Lord , as some of them tried him and were destroyed by serpents .
46 010 010	Nor murmur , as some of them murmured and perished by the destroyer .
46 010 011	These things happened to those people as warnings and they were written for the instruction of us to whom the closing events of the ages have come .
46 010 012	So let him who thinks that he is standing beware of falling .

46 010 013	No trial has taken you but what belongs to human nature . God is faithful and he will not let you be tried beyond your power , but will make , with the trial , a way of escape so that you can endure it .
46 010 014	Therefore , my beloved , shun idolatry .
46 010 015	I speak as to thoughtful men . Judge for yourselves what I am saying .
46 010 016	The cup of blessing which we bless , is it not a fellowship in the blood of Christ ? The bread which we break , is it not a fellowship in the body of Christ ?
46 010 017	Because there is one bread we though many are one body ; for we all partake of the one bread .
46 010 018	Look at Israel according to the flesh ; are not those who eat of the sacrifice partakers of the altar ?
46 010 019	What then am I saying ? That meat sacrificed to idols is anything or that an idol is anything ?
46 010 020	But I say that what they sacrifice they sacrifice to demons and not to God . And I would not have you become partakers with demons .
46 010 021	You cannot drink the cup of the Lord and the cup of demons . You cannot partake of the table of the Lord and the table of demons .
46 010 022	Or are we arousing the jealousy of the Lord ? Are we stronger than he ?
46 010 023	All things are lawful , but not all are beneficial . All things are lawful , but not all build up character .
46 010 024	Let no one seek his own interest , but the interest of others .
46 010 025	Everything that is sold in market eat , raising no questions of conscience .
46 010 026	For " the earth is the Lord's and the fullness thereof . "
46 010 027	If any one of the unbelievers invites you and you wish to go , eat whatever is set before you , raising no questions of conscience .
46 010 028	But if any one says to you , " This is meat that has been sacrificed , " do not eat , for the sake of him who mentioned it and for conscience ' sake —
46 010 029	conscience , I say , not yours , but the other man's . For why is my liberty judged by the conscience of another ?
46 010 030	If I partake with thanksgiving , why am I denounced for that for which I give thanks ?
46 010 031	Therefore , if you eat or if you drink or whatever you do , do all to the glory of God .
46 010 032	Cause no offense either to Jews or Greeks or to the church of God ,
46 010 033	as I also in all things accommodate myself to all men , not seeking my own interest but that of the many , in order that they may be saved .
46 011 001	IMITATE me as I imitate Christ .
46 011 002	I praise you because you remember me in all things and hold firmly the traditions as I passed them on to you .
46 011 003	I wish you to know that the head of every man is Christ , and the head of a woman is her husband , and the head of Christ is God .
46 011 004	Every man praying or prophesying with his head draped dishonors his head .
46 011 005	But every woman praying or prophesying bareheaded dishonors her head . For it is one and the same as if she had her head shaved .
46 011 006	For if a woman is not covered , then let her cut off her hair . But if it is a shame to a woman to cut off her hair or to shave , let her veil herself .
46 011 007	For a man has no need to cover his head since he is the image and glory of God . But the woman is the glory of man .
46 011 008	For man was not from woman , but woman from man ,
46 011 009	for man was not formed for woman , but woman for man .
46 011 010	Therefore , the woman ought to have a badge of authority on her head because of the angels .
46 011 011	Yet neither is woman without man nor man without woman in the Lord .
46 011 012	For as woman is from man so is man through woman , but all things from God .
46 011 013	Decide for yourselves : is it becoming for a woman to pray to God unveiled ?
46 011 014	Does not Nature herself teach you that if a man has long hair , it is a dishonor to him ,
46 011 015	but that if a woman has long hair , it is a glory to her ? Because the hair is given to her for a covering .
46 011 016	But if any one cares to be contentious , we have no such custom , nor have the churches of God .
46 011 017	In giving the following directions I do not praise you , because you do not assemble for the better , but for the worse .
46 011 018	For , in the first place , I hear that when you assemble as a church there are parties among you , and to some extent I believe it .
46 011 019	For there must be parties among you in order that it may become plain who are worthy of approval .
46 011 020	When , therefore , you assemble it is not possible to eat the Lord's supper .
46 011 021	For in eating each one tries to get his own supper first and one is hungry and another is drunken .

46 011 022	Have you not homes to eat and drink in ? Or do you mean to show contempt for the church of God and put to shame those who have no homes ? What shall I say to you ? Shall I praise you ? For this I do not praise you .
46 011 023	For I received from the Lord that which I passed on to you that the Lord Jesus , on the night in which he was betrayed , took bread ,
46 011 024	and when he had given thanks he broke it and said , " This is my body which is broken for you . Do this in memory of me . "
46 011 025	In like manner he took also the cup after supper , saying , " This cup is the new covenant in my blood . Do this , as often as you drink it , in memory of me . "
46 011 026	For as often as you eat this bread and drink the cup you proclaim the Lord's death , until he comes .
46 011 027	Therefore , whoever eats the bread or drinks the cup of the Lord unworthily will be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord .
46 011 028	But let a man examine himself and so let him eat of the bread and drink of the cup .
46 011 029	For he who eats and drinks eats and drinks condemnation to himself , if he does not honor the Lord's body .
46 011 030	For this reason many are weak and sickly among you and a number are asleep .
46 011 031	If we judged ourselves we should not be judged .
46 011 032	But when we are judged by the Lord , we are disciplined in order that we may not be condemned along with the world .
46 011 033	So then , my brethren , when you assemble to eat , wait for one another .
46 011 034	If any one is hungry , let him eat at home , that your assembling may not bring condemnation on you . The other matters I will arrange when I come .
46 012 001	CONCERNING spiritual things , brethren , I do not wish you to be ignorant .
46 012 002	For you know that when you were Gentiles you were led away after the dumb idols just as might happen .
46 012 003	Therefore I inform you that no one speaking in the Spirit of God says , " Jesus is accursed , " and no one can say , " Jesus is Lord , " except in the Holy Spirit .
46 012 004	There are varieties of gifts , but the same Spirit .
46 012 005	And there are varieties of service , but the same Lord .
46 012 006	And there are varieties of products , but the same God who produces all things in all .
46 012 007	To each one is given some manifestation of the Spirit for what is profitable .
46 012 008	To one are given , through the Spirit , words of wisdom , to another words of knowledge by the same Spirit ,
46 012 009	to another faith by the same Spirit , to another gifts of healing by the same Spirit ,
46 012 010	to another works of power , to another prophecy , to another the discernment of spirits , to another varieties of tongues , to another interpretation of tongues .
46 012 011	One and the same Spirit produces all of these gifts , distributing to each one individually as he will .
46 012 012	For as the body is one and yet has many members , and all the members of the body , though many , are one body , so also is Christ .
46 012 013	For in one Spirit we were all baptized into one body , whether Jews or Greeks , whether slaves or free , and were all made to drink of one Spirit .
46 012 014	For the body is not one member , but many .
46 012 015	If the foot says , " Because I am not a hand I am not of the body , " it is not for that reason not of the body .
46 012 016	And if the ear says , " Because I am not an eye I am not of the body , " it is not for that reason not of the body .
46 012 017	If the whole body were an eye , where would be the hearing ? If the whole were hearing , where would be the smelling ?
46 012 018	But now God has placed the members each one of them in the body as he pleased .
46 012 019	If all were one member , where would be the body ?
46 012 020	But now the members are many , but the body is one .
46 012 021	And the eye cannot say to the hand , " I have no need of you , " or the head to the feet , " I have no need of you . "
46 012 022	Indeed , much more those members of the body that seem to be the weaker are necessary ,
46 012 023	and those that we deem the less honorable parts of the body we surround with greater honor and our uncomely parts have additional dignity ,
46 012 024	while our comely parts have no need . But God has organized the body , giving greater honor to the part that lacks ,
46 012 025	that there may be no discord in the body , but that the members may have a common concern for one another .
46 012 026	And if one member suffers , all the members suffer with it ; if a member is honored , all the members rejoice with it .
46 012 027	You are the body of Christ and individually members .

46 012 028	God placed some in the church first as apostles , secondly as prophets , thirdly as teachers , then miracle-workers , then those with gifts of healing , helpers , administrators , speakers of different kinds of tongues .
46 012 029	Are all apostles ? Are all prophets ? Are all teachers ? Are all miracle-workers ?
46 012 030	Do all have gifts of healing ? Do all speak with tongues ? Do all interpret ?
46 012 031	Seek earnestly for the greater gifts ; and yet I will show you a way that surpasses all .
46 013 001	IF I speak with the tongues of men and of angels , but have not love , I have become sounding brass or a clanging cymbal .
46 013 002	And if I have the power of prophecy and understand all mysteries and all knowledge , and if I have all faith , so as to remove mountains , but have not love , I am nothing .
46 013 003	And if I distribute all that I have to feed the poor , and if I give my body to be burned , but have not love , it profits me nothing .
46 013 004	Love is longsuffering , love is kind , is not jealous , love does not boast , is not conceited ,
46 013 005	does not behave unbecomingly , does not seek her own interest , is not irritable , does not count up her wrongs ,
46 013 006	does not rejoice in wickedness , but rejoices with the truth ,
46 013 007	excuses all things , believes all things , hopes all things , endures all things .
46 013 008	Love never fails ; but if there are prophetic powers , they will become useless ; if there are tongues , they will cease ; if there is knowledge , it will become useless .
46 013 009	For we know in part and we prophesy in part ,
46 013 010	but when the perfect comes what is in part will become useless .
46 013 011	When I was a child , I talked like a child , I thought like a child , I reasoned like a child . Since I have become a man , I have no use for childish things .
46 013 012	For as yet we are looking at puzzling reflections in a mirror , but then face to face . As yet I know in part , but then I shall know fully , as I have been fully known .
46 013 013	But now faith , hope , love — these three — endure . And the greatest of these is love .
46 014 001	SEEK love earnestly , be eager for spiritual gifts , but most to prophesy .
46 014 002	For he who speaks with a tongue speaks not to men , but to God . For no one understands , and he speaks mysteries in the Spirit .
46 014 003	But he who prophesies speaks to men what will build up , encourage , and comfort .
46 014 004	He who speaks in a tongue builds himself up , but he who prophesies builds up the church .

46 014 005	I wish you all to speak with tongues , but I wish more to have you prophesy . He who prophesies is greater than he who speaks with tongues , unless he interprets so that the church may receive upbuilding .
46 014 006	Now , brethren , if I come to you speaking with tongues , what benefit will I be to you unless I speak to you in a revelation or in knowledge or in prophecy or in teaching .
46 014 007	Inanimate things that give a sound , such as the flute or harp , — unless they give a distinction in the sounds , how will it be known what is being played on flute or harp ?
46 014 008	If the trumpet gives a dubious sound , who will prepare himself for battle ?
46 014 009	And so you , if you do not give by the tongue words easy to understand , how will it be known what is said ? For you will be talking into the air .
46 014 010	There are , it may be , so many kinds of languages in the world , and none without meaning .
46 014 011	If then I do not know the meaning of the language , I shall be a barbarian to him who is speaking , and he will be a barbarian to me .
46 014 012	And so you , since you are eager for spiritual gifts , seek to abound in what will build up the church .
46 014 013	Therefore let him who speaks with a tongue pray to interpret .
46 014 014	For if I pray in a tongue my spirit prays , but my understanding is unfruitful .
46 014 015	What then ? I will pray with the spirit and with the understanding . I will sing with the spirit and with the understanding .
46 014 016	If you thank God with the spirit , how shall he who fills the place of the ordinary man say Amen to your thanksgiving ? For he does not know what you are saying .
46 014 017	You give thanks excellently , but the other is not helped by it .
46 014 018	I thank God that I speak with tongues more than any of you .
46 014 019	But in church I would rather speak five words with my understanding so as to instruct others , than to speak ten thousand words in a tongue .
46 014 020	Brethren , be not children in intelligence , but be babes in wickedness . In intelligence be adults .
46 014 021	In the Law it is written , " By men of strange speech and by the lips of strangers I will speak to this people , and not even thus will they listen to me , says the Lord . "
46 014 022	So then tongues are for a sign not to believers , but to unbelievers , and prophecy is not for unbelievers , but for believers .
46 014 023	If therefore the whole church assembles and all speak with tongues and ordinary men or unbelievers come in , will they not say that you are insane ?
46 014 024	But if all prophesy and any unbeliever or ordinary man comes in , he is convinced by all , he is judged by all ,
46 014 025	the secrets of his heart become manifest , and so falling on his face he worships God , declaring that God is really among you .

46 014 026	What then , brethren ? When you assemble each one has a psalm , has a teaching , has a revelation , has a tongue , has an interpretation . Let all things be done for the upbuilding of character .
46 014 027	If any one speaks with a tongue , let it be two , or at the most three , at a time and in turn and let one interpret .
46 014 028	If there is no interpreter , let the man keep silent in church and let him speak to himself and to God .
46 014 029	Of the prophets let two or three speak and let the others reflect .
46 014 030	If a revelation comes to another who is sitting by , let the first become silent .
46 014 031	For you can all prophesy one by one so that all may learn and all be encouraged .
46 014 032	The spirits of the prophets are under the control of the prophets .
46 014 033	For God is not a God of confusion , but of peace . As in all the churches of the holy ,
46 014 034	let the women be silent in your assemblies . For it is not allowed to them to speak ; but let them be in subjection as also the Law says .
46 014 035	If they wish to learn anything , let them ask their own husbands at home . For it is disgraceful for a woman to speak in church .
46 014 036	Did the message of God come out from you or did it come to you alone ?
46 014 037	If any one thinks himself a prophet or spiritual , let him recognize that what I am writing to you is the command of the Lord .
46 014 038	But if any one does not know , he is himself unknown .
46 014 039	So then , my brethren , seek earnestly to prophesy and do not hinder speaking with tongues .
46 014 040	Let all things be done becomingly and in order .
46 015 001	LET me recall to your minds , brethren , the good news which I announced to you and which you accepted , in which also you stand ,
46 015 002	through which also you are being saved , if you hold fast the message that I announced to you , unless your faith was thoughtless .
46 015 003	For among the first things I passed on to you what I had received , that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures ,
46 015 004	and that he was buried , and that he was raised on the third day , according to the Scriptures ,
46 015 005	and that he was seen by Cephas , then by the twelve ,
46 015 006	then he was seen by more than five hundred brethren at once , of whom the most are still living , but some have fallen asleep ,
46 015 007	then he appeared to James , then to all the apostles .
46 015 008	Last of all , as if to one untimely born , he appeared also to me .
46 015 009	For I am the least of the apostles and am not fit to be called an apostle , because I persecuted the church of God .

46 015 010	But by the grace of God I am what I am , and his grace toward me was not without result , but I labored more abundantly than all of them , yet not I , but the grace of God that was with me .
46 015 011	Whether then it was I or they , so we proclaim and so you believed .
46 015 012	But if Christ is proclaimed — that he has been raised from the dead — how do some among you say that there is no resurrection of the dead ?
46 015 013	If there is no resurrection of the dead , then neither has Christ been raised .
46 015 014	If Christ has not been raised , then our proclamation is an empty thing and your faith is an empty thing .
46 015 015	And we are found false witnesses of God because we testified regarding God that he raised up Christ , whom he did not raise if the dead are not raised .
46 015 016	For if the dead are not raised , neither has Christ been raised .
46 015 017	And if Christ has not been raised , your faith is futile , you are still in your sins .
46 015 018	Then also those who have fallen asleep in Christ have perished .
46 015 019	If in this life only we have hope in Christ , we are of all men most pitiable .
46 015 020	But now Christ has been raised from the dead , the first-fruit of those who have fallen asleep .
46 015 021	For since by a man came death , by a man also came resurrection of the dead .
46 015 022	For as in Adam all die , so also in Christ all will be made alive .
46 015 023	But each in his own order . The first-fruit is Christ , then those who are Christ's , at his coming .
46 015 024	Then will be the end when he delivers up the kingship to God his Father , when he has defeated every archangel and authority and power .
46 015 025	For he must be king until he " puts all his enemies under his feet . "
46 015 026	The last enemy to be defeated will be death .
46 015 027	For " he subjected all things under his feet . " But when it says , " all things have been subjected , " it is plain that it means all things except God who subjected all things to him .
46 015 028	But when all things have been subjected to him , then the Son himself will be subjected to him who subjected all things to him , that God may be all in all .
46 015 029	Then what shall they do who are baptized for the dead ? If the dead do not rise at all , why are they then baptized for them ?
46 015 030	And why do we run risks every hour ?
46 015 031	I die every day , I swear it by the boast I make of you and which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord .
46 015 032	If , humanly speaking , I fought wild beasts at Ephesus , what is my gain ? If the dead do not rise , " let us eat and drink , for to-morrow we die . "
46 015 033	Do not be led astray ; " bad associations corrupt good morals . "
46 015 034	Return to soberness and cease to sin , for some are ignorant of God . I say it to your shame .
46 015 035	But some one will say , How are the dead raised , and with what sort of bodies do they come ?
46 015 036	Thoughtless man ! What you yourself sow does not come to life unless it dies .
46 015 037	And what you sow is not the body that will come , but a mere grain , perhaps of wheat or of something else .
46 015 038	But God gives it a body as he has pleased , and to each kind of seed a body of its own .
46 015 039	All flesh is not the same flesh , but there is one kind of flesh of men , another flesh of beasts , another flesh of birds , and another flesh of fishes .
46 015 040	There are bodies celestial and bodies terrestrial . But the glory of the celestial is of one kind and the glory of the terrestrial is of another .
46 015 041	There is one glory of the sun and another glory of the moon and another glory of the stars . For star differs from star in glory .
46 015 042	So also will be the resurrection of the dead . It is sown in decay ; it is raised imperishable .
46 015 043	It is sown in dishonor ; it is raised in glory . It is sown in weakness ; it is raised in power .
46 015 044	It is sown an animal body ; it is raised a spiritual body . If there is an animal body there is also a spiritual body .
46 015 045	Just as it is written , " The first man Adam became a living animal , " the last Adam became a lifegiving spirit .
46 015 046	But the spiritual is not first , but the animal , then the spiritual .
46 015 047	The first man was from the earth , earthly ; the second man is the Lord from heaven .
46 015 048	As is the earthly man such are also those who are earthly , and as is the heavenly man such are also those who are heavenly .
46 015 049	And as we have borne the image of the earthly man , we shall bear the image of the heavenly man .
46 015 050	But I say this , brethren , flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God , nor will decay inherit imperishability .
46 015 051	I am telling you a mystery . We shall not all fall asleep , but we shall all be transformed ,
46 015 052	in a moment , in the twinkling of an eye , at the last trumpet-call . For the trumpet will sound and the dead will be raised imperishable , and we shall be transformed .
46 015 053	For this perishable must clothe itself with imperishability , and this mortal must clothe itself with immortality .

46 015 054	When this perishable has clothed itself with imperishability and this mortal has clothed itself with immortality , then will come to pass the word that is written , " Death has been swallowed up in victory .
46 015 055	O Death , where is thy victory ? O Death , where is thy sting ? "
46 015 056	The sting of death is sin , and the power of sin is the Law .
46 015 057	But thanks be to God who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ !
46 015 058	So then , my beloved brethren , be firm , immovable , always abounding in the work of the Lord ; since you know that your labor is not fruitless in the Lord .
46 016 001	REGARDING the collection for the holy , as I arranged for the churches of Galatia , you must do the same .
46 016 002	On the first day of the week let each of you lay up at home something according as he may be prospering , in order that no collections may be going on when I come .
46 016 003	When I come , whatever persons you may approve , I will send with letters to carry your gracious gift to Jerusalem .
46 016 004	And if it seems best for me to go , they shall go with me .
46 016 005	I shall come to you alter I pass through Macedonia . For I shall pass through Macedonia
46 016 006	and perhaps I shall make some stay with you or pass the winter with you , so that you may send me forward wherever I may be going .
46 016 007	I do not wish to see you now merely in passing , for I hope to spend some time with you , if the Lord permits .
46 016 008	I shall remain in Ephesus until Pentecost ,
46 016 009	for a great and effective door has been opened to me , and there are many opponents .
46 016 010	If Timothy comes , see to it that he becomes free from fear in his relations to you . For he is doing the Lord's work , just as I am .
46 016 011	So let no one think him of no account . Send him forward in peace on his journey to me , for I am expecting him with the brethren .
46 016 012	As to Apollos our brother , I urged him strongly to go to you with the brethren . But it was not at all his will to go now , but he will come when it is convenient .
46 016 013	Watch , stand firmly in the faith , be manly , be strong ,
46 016 014	let all that you do be done in love .
46 016 015	I beg you , brethren — you know the household of Stephanas , that it is the first-fruit of Achaia and they have devoted themselves to serving the holy —
46 016 016	I beg you to show deference to such and to every fellow worker and laborer .
46 016 017	I rejoice in the arrival of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus , because they made up for my lack of you .
46 016 018	For they refreshed my spirit and yours . Appreciate such men .
46 016 019	The churches of Asia send you their greetings . Aquila and Prisca with the church in their house greet you heartily in the Lord .
46 016 020	All the brethren send greetings to you . Greet one another with a holy kiss .
46 016 021	Here is the greeting of me , Paul , by my own hand .
46 016 022	If any one does not love the Lord , let him be accursed ! Maran atha !
46 016 023	The grace of the Lord Jesus be with you .
46 016 024	My love to all of you in Christ Jesus .
47 001 001	PAUL , an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God , and Timothy the brother , to the church of God that is in Corinth with all the holy that are in all Achaia :
47 001 002	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ !
47 001 003	Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ , the Father of loving kindness and the God of all encouragement ,
47 001 004	who encourages us in every distress so that we may be able to encourage those who are in every distress by the encouragement by which we ourselves have been encouraged by God .
47 001 005	Because as the sufferings of Christ are abundant in our case , so through Christ our encouragement is abundant .

47 001 006	But if we are in distress , it is for your encouragement and salvation . If we are encouraged , it is for your encouragement which is effective in the endurance of the same sufferings that we suffer .
47 001 007	Our hope is strong regarding you , since we know that as you are partakers of the sufferings so you are of the encouragement .

47 001 008	For we do not wish you to be ignorant , brethren , regarding the distress that came on us in Asia — that we were exceedingly weighed down , beyond our strength , so that we despaired even of life .
47 001 009	Indeed we have the sentence of death within ourselves , that our trust may not rest on ourselves , but on God who raises the dead .
47 001 010	He delivered us from such a death and will deliver , and we have hope in him that he will go on delivering ,
47 001 011	while you help by your prayers for us , so that from many persons thanksgiving may arise for the gift granted to us through the prayers of many for us .

47 001 012	For this is what we boast of , the witness of our conscience that in holiness , and sincerity before God , not in fleshly wisdom , but in the grace of God , we have lived in the world and especially toward you .
47 001 013	For we are not writing to you anything but what you read and acknowledge and I hope you will acknowledge to the end ,
47 001 014	as you have partly acknowledged it about us , that we are your ground of boasting and you are ours on the day of our Lord Jesus .
47 001 015	With this confidence I intended to come to you first , so that you might have a second favor ,
47 001 016	by my visiting you on the way to Macedonia and again coming back from Macedonia to you and being sped by you on my way toward Juda .
47 001 017	When I was intending this , did I show fickleness ? Or do I plan what I plan according to the flesh , so that I may say yes , yes , and no , no ?
47 001 018	As God is faithful , my word to you is not yes and no .
47 001 019	For the Son of God , Christ Jesus , who was proclaimed among you by us — myself and Silvanus and Timothy — was not yes and no , but in him was yes .
47 001 020	For all the promises of God , however many , have their yes in him . Therefore also through him is the Amen to the glory of God through us .
47 001 021	It is God who makes us and you steadfast to Christ , and has anointed us
47 001 022	and sealed us and has given the pledge of the Spirit in our hearts .
47 001 023	I call God as a witness against my soul that in order to spare you I have not yet come to Corinth .
47 001 024	Not that we are lords over your faith , but fellow workers sharing your joy , for you are standing firm in the faith .
47 002 001	BUT I decided this in my own mind , not to come again to you in sorrow .
47 002 002	For if I grieve you , who is there to cheer me except those who are grieved by me ?
47 002 003	I am writing this very thing so that I may not come and have grief from those who ought to make me glad , for I am confident in regard to all of you that my joy is yours .

47 004 001	THEREFORE , having this service through God's mercy , we are not downhearted ,

47 004 002	but we have renounced shameful secret things , not living in craftiness nor adulterating God's message , but by the openness of truth commending ourselves to every man's conscience in the sight of God .

47 006 001	AS God's fellow workers we also beg you not to receive his grace fruitlessly .
47 006 002	For he says , " At a favorable time I heard you and on a day of salvation I helped you . " Now is a particularly favorable time , now is a day of salvation .

47 007 001	HAVING then these promises , beloved , let us purify ourselves from every defilement of flesh or spirit , in reverence for God making our holiness complete .
47 007 002	Make room for us in your hearts . We have wronged no one ; we have injured no one ; we have taken advantage of no one .

47 013 009	We rejoice when we are weak and you are strong . This we are praying for , your all-round character .

47 013 010	For this reason I am writing this while absent , so that when present I may not act with severity in the use of the authority which the Lord gave me for building you up , not for pulling you down .
47 013 011	Now , brethren , farewell . Be fully equipped ; take courage ; be of one mind ; live in peace ; then the God of love and peace will be with you .
47 013 012	Greet one another with a holy kiss .
47 013 013	All the holy send greetings .
47 013 014	The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ , and the love of God , and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit be with you all .
48 001 001	PAUL an apostle — not from men or through men , but through Jesus Christ and God the Father , who raised him from the dead —
48 001 002	and all the brethren with me , to the churches of Galatia :
48 001 003	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ ,
48 001 004	who gave himself for our sins to deliver us from the present wicked world according to the will of our God and Father !
48 001 005	To him be glory through the ages of the ages ! Amen .
48 001 006	I am astonished that you are so quickly changing over from him who called you by the grace of Christ to a different kind of good news ,
48 001 007	though it is not another good news . But there are some who are perplexing you and wishing to pervert the good news of Christ .
48 001 008	But even if we , or an angel from heaven , should bring you any good news different from what we did bring you , let him be accursed !
48 001 009	As I said before , I say now again , if any one brings you good news different from what you have received , let him be accursed !
48 001 010	Am I now trying to please men or God ? If I were still trying to please men I should not be Christ's servant .
48 001 011	For I assure you , brethren , that the good news which I brought is not of man's devising .
48 001 012	For neither did I receive it from man nor was I taught it through man , but through a revelation of Jesus Christ .
48 001 013	You have heard of my former life in Judaism , that I furiously persecuted the church of God and made havoc of it ,
48 001 014	and I went further in Judaism than many of my own age and race , being intensely zealous for the traditions of my forefathers .
48 001 015	But when he who had appointed me when I was in my mother's womb , and had called me by his grace ,
48 001 016	was pleased to reveal his Son in me that I might tell the good news of him among the Gentiles , immediately I did not consult with flesh and blood ,
48 001 017	nor did I go up to Jerusalem to those who were apostles before me , but I went away into Arabia , and came back to Damascus .
48 001 018	Then , after three years , I went up to Jerusalem to visit Peter and stayed with him fifteen days .
48 001 019	But I saw no other one of the apostles , though I did see James the Lord's brother .
48 001 020	In what I am writing to you , before God I am not lying .
48 001 021	Then I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia .
48 001 022	I was not known by face to the churches of Christ in Judaea .
48 001 023	Only they had heard that " he who used to persecute us is now telling the good news of the faith of which he once made havoc , "
48 001 024	and they glorified God on my account .
48 002 001	THEN after fourteen years I again went up to Jerusalem with Barnabas , taking along Titus .

48 002 002	I went up by revelation , and I stated to them the good news which I proclaim among the Gentiles . But I did this privately before those who were most esteemed , that I might not be running , or have run , to no Purpose .
48 002 003	But even Titus , who was with me and was a Greek , was not compelled to be circumcised ,
48 002 004	though it was suggested on account of false brethren who had been brought in , who had crept in to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus , in order to enslave us .
48 002 005	But we did not yield in subjection to them even for an hour , that the truth of the good news might continue with you .

48 002 006	But from those who were esteemed to be something — whatever they were , it makes no difference to me ; God does not regard the social standing of a man — those who were most esteemed did not impart to me anything additional .
48 002 007	But , on the contrary , seeing that I was entrusted with the good news for the uncircumcision as Peter was for the circumcision ,
48 002 008	for he who had worked in Peter for the apostleship to the circumcision had worked in me for the Gentiles ,

48 002 009	recognizing the grace given to me , James , Cephas , and John , who were regarded as pillars , gave the right hand of fellowship to me and Barnabas , that we should go to the Gentiles and they to the circumcision .
48 002 010	Only they wished us to remember the poor . This very thing I also was earnest in doing .
48 002 011	But when Peter came to Antioch , I opposed him to his face , because he had been justly censured .
48 002 012	For before certain persons came from James , he was eating with the Gentiles . But when they came , he drew back and separated himself , fearing those who were of the circumcision .
48 002 013	And the rest of the Jews practiced the same hypocrisy with him , so that even Barnabas was led off with them in their hypocrisy .

48 002 014	But when I saw that they were not walking straight according to the truth of the good news , I said to Cephas before them all , " If you who are a Jew are living like a Gentile and not like a Jew , how can you compel the Gentiles to live like Jews ? "
48 002 015	We who are Jews by nature and not sinners of the Gentiles ,

48 002 016	knowing that a man is not declared righteous because of works of law , but through faith in Christ Jesus , we also have put our faith in Christ Jesus that we may be declared righteous because of faith in Christ , and not because of works of law , for because of works of law no human being will be declared righteous .
48 002 017	If while seeking to be declared righteous in Christ we ourselves are found sinners , is Christ then a servant of sin ? Never .
48 002 018	For if I am building up again what I pulled down , I show myself as a transgressor .
48 002 019	For I through law died to law that I might live to God .

48 002 020	I have been crucified with Christ . I am living , yet no longer I , but Christ is living in me . The life that I am now living in flesh I am living by faith in the Son of God , who loved me and gave himself for me .
48 002 021	I do not make nothing of the grace of God , for if righteousness is through law , then Christ died for nothing .
48 003 001	O THOUGHTLESS Galatians , who has bewitched you before whose eyes Jesus Christ was pictured crucified ?
48 003 002	Only this I wish to learn from you : Was it because of works of law that you received the Spirit , or because of hearing with faith ?
48 003 003	Are you so thoughtless ? After beginning with spirit are you now finishing with flesh ?
48 003 004	Have you suffered such things to no purpose ? — if it is to no purpose .
48 003 005	He who supplies to you the Spirit and works miracles among you , is he doing it because of works of law or because of hearing with faith ,
48 003 006	just as Abraham had faith in God and it was credited to him for righteousness ?
48 003 007	You know , then , that those who are of faith — they are children of Abraham .

48 003 008	For the Scripture , foreseeing that God would declare the Gentiles righteous because of faith , announced the good news in advance to Abraham , " In you all the Gentiles will be blessed . "
48 003 009	So then those who are of faith are blessed with faithful Abraham .
48 003 010	For all who are of the works of law are under a curse , for it is written , " Cursed is every one who does not abide by all the precepts of the book of the Law and do them . "
48 003 011	But that by law no one is declared righteous before God is plain , because , " He who is righteous by faith shall live . "
48 003 012	But the Law is not of faith , but " He who does these things shall live by them . "
48 003 013	Christ redeemed us from the curse of the Law by becoming a curse for our sake , for it is written , " Cursed is every one who hangs on a tree , "
48 003 014	in order that the blessing of Abraham might in Jesus Christ come on the Gentiles , that they might receive through faith the promise of the Spirit .
48 003 015	Brethren , I am speaking humanly , a ratified covenant , although but a man's , no one can set aside or add to .

48 003 016	But the promises were spoken to Abraham and to his offspring . It does not say , " and to offsprings , " as meaning many , but as if meaning one , " and to your offspring , " who is Christ .
48 003 017	I mean this , a covenant ratified by God , the Law that came four hundred and thirty years afterward does not annul , so as to defeat the promise .
48 003 018	For if the inheritance is by law , it is no longer by promise . But God granted it to Abraham by promise .

48 003 019	Why then was the Law ? It was added later to make transgressions , until the Offspring should come to whom the promise had been made , and it was arranged through angels by the hand of a mediator .
48 003 020	A mediator does not belong to one person , but God is one .
48 003 021	Is the Law then against the promises of God ? Never ! For if a law had been given which could give life , then really righteousness would have come by law .
48 003 022	But the Scripture has shut up all under sin that the promise based on faith in Jesus Christ may be given to those who have faith .
48 003 023	Before faith came we were guarded under law , shut up waiting for the faith that was to be revealed .
48 003 024	Thus the Law became our tutor leading us to Christ , that we might be declared righteous by faith .
48 003 025	Now that faith has come , we are no longer under a tutor .
48 003 026	You are all sons of God through faith in Christ Jesus .
48 003 027	All who have been baptized into Christ have put on Christ .
48 003 028	There cannot be Jew or Greek , slave or free , male or female : for you all are one in Christ Jesus .
48 003 029	If you are Christ's , then you are Abraham's offspring and heirs according to the promise .
48 004 001	I SAY that as long as the heir is under age he differs in nothing from a slave , though he be owner of all .
48 004 002	But he is under guardians and managers until the day appointed by the father .
48 004 003	So we , when we were under age , were enslaved under the elementary lessons of the world ;
48 004 004	but , when the fullness of time came , God sent forth his Son born of a woman , born under the Law ,
48 004 005	that he might redeem those who were under Law , that we might receive the recognition as sons .
48 004 006	Because you are sons , God has sent into our hearts the Spirit of his Son crying Abba , Father .
48 004 007	So you are no longer a slave , but a son , and if a son , then also an heir , through God's act .
48 004 008	At the time when you did not know God you were enslaved to what by nature are not gods .
48 004 009	But now that you know God , or rather have been known by God , how are you turning back to the weak and beggarly elementary lessons to which you wish to be slaves again ?
48 004 010	You observe days and months and seasons and years .
48 004 011	You make me afraid that I have labored over you uselessly .
48 004 012	Become like me , brethren , I beg of you , for I became like you . You have not wronged me in anything .
48 004 013	You know that because of weakness of the flesh I told you the good news at first .
48 004 014	And you did not despise or spurn what was a trial to you in my bodily condition , but welcomed me as you would an angel of God , as you would Christ Jesus .
48 004 015	Where now is the blessing you pronounced on me ? For I bear you witness that if it had been possible you would have plucked out your own eyes and given them to me .
48 004 016	Have I become your enemy because I tell you the truth ?
48 004 017	They are paying court to you , but not honorably . No , they wish to shut you out , so that you may pay court to them .
48 004 018	It is honorable to be courted in an honorable matter always , and not only when I am with you ,
48 004 019	my children , for whom I again am suffering birth pangs until Christ is formed in you .
48 004 020	Would that I could be present with you now and could change my tone , for I am at a loss about you .
48 004 021	Tell me , you who wish to be under law , do you not hear the Law ?

48 005 001	STAND firm , therefore , in the freedom with which Christ set us free , and do not wear any yoke of slavery .

48 005 008	The persuasion was not from him who called you .
48 005 009	A little yeast sets the whole lump fermenting .

48 005 020	idolatry , magic , hatred , strife , jealousy , anger , rivalries , dissensions , factions ,

48 005 021	envyings , drinking bouts , revelries , and the like . Of these I tell you beforehand , as I have already told you , that those who practice such things will not inherit the kingdom of God .

48 005 023	gentleness , self-control ; against such there is no law .
48 005 024	Those who belong to Christ Jesus have crucified the flesh with its emotions and passions .
48 005 025	If we are living in the Spirit let us direct our lives by the Spirit .

48 006 001	BRETHREN , if a man is surprised in some sin , you who are spiritual are to restore such a one in a spirit of gentleness , each looking out for himself to avoid being tempted .
48 006 002	Bear one another's burdens and so fulfill the law of Christ .
48 006 003	If any one thinks that he is something when he is nothing , he deceives himself .
48 006 004	Let each one test his own work and then he will have his reason for boasting in himself alone and not in another .
48 006 005	For each must bear his own load .
48 006 006	Let him who is taught the message share with his teacher in all good things .
48 006 007	Do not be deceived ; God is not mocked ; what a man sows that he will also reap .
48 006 008	For he who sows to his own flesh will from the flesh reap decay ; but he who sows to the Spirit will from the Spirit reap life eternal .
48 006 009	Let us not grow discouraged in doing what is noble , for in due time we shall reap if we do not grow faint .
