51 004 012	Epaphras , the servant of Christ Jesus , who is one of you , sends his greetings to you . He always wrestles in prayer on your behalf that you may stand mature and fully assured in all the will of God .
51 004 013	I bear witness to the burden that he carries for you and for those in Laodicea and those in Hierapolis .
51 004 014	Luke , the beloved physician , and Demas send you their greetings .
51 004 015	Give our greeting to the brethren in Laodicea and to Nympha and the church that meets in her house .
51 004 016	When this letter has been read among you , have it read in the church of the Laodiceans , and you are to read the letter that will come from Laodicea .
51 004 017	Say to Archippus , See to it that you fully perform the service which you have accepted in the Lord .
51 004 018	The greeting of Paul , by my own hand . Remember my chains . Grace be with you .
52 001 001	PAUL and Silvanus and Timothy , to the Church of the Thessalonians in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ : Grace to you and peace .
52 001 002	We thank God always for you all when we mention you in our prayers ,
52 001 003	unceasingly remembering your work of faith and labor of love and patience of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ before God our Father .
52 001 004	We know , brethren beloved by God , that he has chosen you
52 001 005	and that our good news came to you not in word only but in power and in the Holy Spirit and in great assurance , just as you know we acted among you for your benefit .
52 001 006	You became imitators of us and of the Lord , receiving the message in great affliction with joy which the Holy Spirit gave ,
52 001 007	so that you became a pattern for all believers in Macedonia and in Achaia .

52 001 008	For the message of the Lord sounded forth from you not only in Macedonia and Achaia , but in every place your faith toward God has gone abroad , so that there is no need for us to speak a word .
52 001 009	For the people themselves are telling about us , what a reception we had with you , and how you turned to God from idols , to serve the living and true God
52 001 010	and to wait for his Son from heaven — his Son Jesus whom he raised from the dead and who is saving us from the coming wrath .
52 002 001	YOU yourselves know , brethren , what a reception we had from you , that it was not without result ,
52 002 002	but after we had suffered and been roughly treated , as you know , in Philippi , we made bold in our God to speak to you the good news of God with great wrestling .
52 002 003	For our appeal springs not from deception , nor from impure motives , nor from cunning ,
52 002 004	but as we have been approved by God to be entrusted with the good news , so we speak , not as if we were pleasing men , but God , who tests our hearts .
52 002 005	Nor did we ever fall into flattering talk , as you know , nor use any pretext for self-enrichment — God is witness —
52 002 006	nor did we seek glory from men , either from you or others , although we could have claimed the dignity of Christ's apostles .
52 002 007	But we became gentle in the midst of you like a nursing mother cherishing her own children .
52 002 008	Yearning over you so , we would gladly have imparted to you not only God's good news but our own lives as well , because you had become dear to us .
52 002 009	For you remember , brethren , our toil and labor as we worked night and day so as not to burden any one of you while we proclaimed to you the good news of God .
52 002 010	You are witnesses — and God is witness — how purely and justly and blamelessly we acted toward you who believe .
52 002 011	You know that just like a father toward his own children we encouraged each one of you , and warned and conjured you
52 002 012	to live lives worthy of the God who is calling you into his own kingdom and glory .

52 002 013	For this reason we unceasingly give thanks to God that when you received from us the report of the message of God you accepted it not as the message of men , but , as it truly is , the message of God , which also is doing its work in you who believe .

52 002 014	For you became imitators , brethren , of the churches of God that are in Judaea in Christ Jesus , because you too suffered the same things from your fellow countrymen that they did from the Jews ,
52 002 015	who killed both the Lord Jesus and the prophets , and drove us out and do not please God and are enemies to all men ,
52 002 016	trying to prevent us from speaking to the Gentiles so that they may be saved . All this goes always to fill up the measure of their sins . But God's fiercest wrath has overtaken them .
52 002 017	But we , brethren , when bereft of you for a little while , out of sight not out of mind , endeavored more earnestly to see your faces , with great longing .
52 002 018	For that reason we determined to come to you , yes , I , Paul , more than once : but Satan hindered us .
52 002 019	For what is our hope or joy or crown to boast of before our Lord Jesus at his coming ? Is it not you ?
52 002 020	You are our glory and joy .
52 003 001	SO when we could no longer endure the anxiety , we chose to be left at Athens alone
52 003 002	and sent Timothy , our brother and God's servant in the good news of Christ , to strengthen and encourage you in your faith ,
52 003 003	that no one might be disturbed in these trials . For you yourselves know that we are destined to this .
52 003 004	For when we were with you we told you in advance , " We shall soon have trouble . " And so it came to pass , as you know .
52 003 005	Therefore , when I could no longer endure the anxiety , I sent to know about your faith for fear that the tempter had tempted you and our labor had gone for nothing .

52 003 006	But now that Timothy has come to us from you and has brought us good news of your faith and love , and that you always keep us well in mind and long to see us , just as we long to see you ,
52 003 007	we have been cheered , brethren , in regard to you , in all our straits and distresses by your faith .
52 003 008	Now we are living , since you are standing firm in the Lord .
52 003 009	For how can we be grateful enough to God for you in view of all the joy we have because of you ,
52 003 010	while we pray beyond measure night and day that we may see your faces and make good whatever lacks there may be in your faith ?
52 003 011	May our God and Father himself and our Lord Jesus Christ open the way for us to come to you .
52 003 012	The Lord make you to abound and overflow in love toward one another and toward all men , just as we do toward you ,
52 003 013	that your hearts may be made firm and you may be blameless in holiness before our God and Father at the coming of our Lord Jesus with all his holy ones .
52 004 001	TO conclude , brethren , we beg of you and urge you in the Lord Jesus that , as you learned from us how you ought to live to please God , and are living , you will excel still more .
52 004 002	For you know what directions we have given you through the Lord Jesus .
52 004 003	For this is the will of God : to have you become holy and have you shun unchastity ;
52 004 004	to have each of you know how to take a wife for himself in holiness and honor ,
52 004 005	not in the passion of lust , as the Gentiles do who know not God ;
52 004 006	to have no one trespass or take advantage of his brother in this matter ; for the Lord is the punisher of all such , as we have already told you and solemnly warned you .
52 004 007	God has not called us to live in impurity , but in holiness .
52 004 008	Therefore he who disregards this disregards not man , but God , who gives his Holy Spirit to you .
52 004 009	Regarding brotherly love you have no need for me to write to you . For you yourselves have been taught by God to love one another ,
52 004 010	and you do the same to all the brethren in the whole of Macedonia . But we urge you , brethren , to excel still further
52 004 011	and to be ambitious to lead a quiet life and to mind each his own business and to work with your hands , as we instructed you .
52 004 012	Thus you will live becomingly in the sight of outsiders and will have need of nothing .
52 004 013	We do not wish you to be ignorant , brethren , regarding those who are sleeping , that you may not sorrow as the rest of men who have no hope .
52 004 014	For since , as we believe , Jesus died and rose , so too God will through Jesus bring with him those who have fallen asleep .
52 004 015	This we tell you by the word of the Lord : We , the living , who have been left until the coming of the Lord , will not have the start of those who have fallen asleep .
52 004 016	For the Lord himself will descend from heaven with a shout , with the voice of an archangel and with God's trumpet-call , and first the dead in Christ will rise .
52 004 017	Then we , the living , who are left , will be caught up along with them into the clouds to meet the Lord in the air . And thus we shall forever be with the Lord .
52 004 018	So encourage one another with these words .
52 005 001	BUT regarding times and dates , brethren , you do not need to have me write to you .
52 005 002	For you yourselves know perfectly that the day of the Lord will come like a thief in the night .
52 005 003	When they are saying , " Peace and safety , " then sudden destruction is upon them , like the pangs upon a woman with child , and they will not escape .
52 005 004	But you , brethren , are not in darkness so that the day can take you like a thief .
52 005 005	You are all sons of light and sons of day . We do not belong to night or to darkness .
52 005 006	Then let us not be sleeping like the rest of men , but let us watch and be sober .
52 005 007	For those who sleep sleep in the night and those who drink drink in the night .
52 005 008	But let us who are of the day be sober . Let us put on the breastplate of faith and love and for a helmet the hope of salvation .
52 005 009	For God has not destined us to wrath , but to the winning of salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ ,
52 005 010	who died for us that whether we are waking or sleeping we may live in company with him .
52 005 011	Therefore encourage one another and build up one another , as indeed you are doing .
52 005 012	We beg you , brethren , to regard those who are laboring among you and who preside over you in the Lord and give you counsel ,
52 005 013	and to esteem them very highly in love on account of their work . Be at peace among yourselves .
52 005 014	We urge you , brethren , to warn the disorderly , encourage the faint-hearted , help the weak , be patient with all .
52 005 015	Take care that no one repays evil with evil , but always seek eagerly what is good in dealing with one another and with every one .
52 005 016	Always be joyful .
52 005 017	Pray without ceasing .
52 005 018	In everything give thanks , for this is God's will in Christ for you .
52 005 019	Do not quench the Spirit .
52 005 020	Do not despise prophecies .
52 005 021	Test all things ; hold fast the good .
52 005 022	Avoid every kind of evil .
52 005 023	May the God of peace himself make you completely holy , and may your spirits and souls and bodies be kept faultless and blameless for the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ .
52 005 024	He is faithful who calls you and he will do it .
52 005 025	Brethren , pray for us .
52 005 026	Greet all the brethren with a holy kiss .
52 005 027	I solemnly charge you in the Lord's name to have this letter read to all the brethren .
52 005 028	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you .
53 001 001	PAUL and Silvanus and Timothy to the Church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ :
53 001 002	Grace to you and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
53 001 003	We ought always to thank God for you , brethren , as is fitting , since your faith is growing greatly and the love of each and all of you toward one another is increasing ,
53 001 004	so that we ourselves glory in you among the churches of God because of your endurance and faith in all of your persecutions and in the distresses you are bearing .
53 001 005	This is a proof of God's righteous judgment . It is to make you worthy of God's kingdom , on behalf of which you are suffering ,
53 001 006	since it is just on God's part to repay with trouble those who are troubling you ,
53 001 007	and to repay to you , who are being troubled , rest with us at the revelation of the Lord Jesus from heaven with his mighty angels .
53 001 008	With flaming fire he will inflict vengeance on those who do not know God and do not obey the good news of our Lord Jesus .
53 001 009	They will suffer the penalty of eternal destruction and be sent away from the face of the Lord and from his glorious power ,
53 001 010	when he comes to be glorified among his holy ones and to be wondered at on that day among all believers — for our testimony to you was believed .
53 001 011	To this end we are always praying for you that our God will make you worthy of the call , and will by his power bring to completion every one of your kind purposes and works of faith ,
53 001 012	that the name of our Lord Jesus may be glorified in you , according to the grace of our God and of the Lord Jesus Christ .
53 002 001	WITH regard to the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and our being gathered to meet him , I beg you , brethren ,
53 002 002	not to be quickly unsettled in mind nor excited by either a revelation or by a message or a letter supposed to be from us , to the effect that the day of the Lord is close at hand .
53 002 003	Let no one lead you astray in any way , because it will not come until the Apostasy has first come and the Man of Lawlessness has been revealed — the Son of Perdition ,
53 002 004	who opposes and exalts himself above everything called God and every object of worship , so that he enters the Temple of God and seats himself there , declaring that he himself is God .
53 002 005	Do you not remember that while I was still with you I used to tell you this ?
53 002 006	And now you know what is restraining him until he is revealed at his appointed time .
53 002 007	For the mystery of lawlessness is already working , only there is just now one who is restraining it until he passes out of the way .
53 002 008	And then the Lawless One will be revealed . But the Lord Jesus will sweep him away with the breath of his mouth and will make him powerless by the splendor of his coming .
53 002 009	For his coming will be when Satan is active in every sort of power and in false signs and wonders
53 002 010	and in every kind of wicked deception of those who are perishing , because they did not receive the love of the truth so that they might be saved .
53 002 011	For this reason God sends to them a deceptive influence so that they believe a lie ,
53 002 012	that all who have not believed the truth but have delighted in wickedness may be condemned .

53 002 013	We ought always to thank God for you , brethren , beloved by the Lord , because God chose you from the beginning for salvation through the Spirit's making you holy and your own faith in the truth .
53 002 014	To this he called you through the good news that we brought , so that you may share the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ .
53 002 015	Now then , brethren , stand firm and hold fast the teachings that you have been taught whether by our words or by our letter .
53 002 016	May our Lord Jesus Christ himself and God our Father , who loved us and gave us eternal encouragement and good hope through grace ,
53 002 017	encourage your hearts and make you strong in every good word and work .
53 003 001	IN conclusion , brethren , pray for us , that the Lord's message may run and be glorified , as among you ,
53 003 002	and that we may be saved from the unreasonable and wicked men , for faith does not belong to all .
53 003 003	But the Lord is faithful and he will strengthen you and guard you from evil .
53 003 004	We are persuaded in the Lord in regard to you that you are doing and will do what we direct .
53 003 005	The Lord guide your hearts in the love of God and the patience of Christ .

53 003 006	We charge you , brethren , in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ , to stand aloof from every brother who is living in a disorderly way and not according to the teaching that you received from us .
53 003 007	For you yourselves know that you should imitate us , for we were not disorderly when among you ,
53 003 008	nor did we eat bread with any one without paying , but with labor and toil night and day we worked in order not to burden any one of you .
53 003 009	Not that we have not the authority , but in order to give you ourselves as an example for you to imitate .
53 003 010	For when we were with you we gave you this command , " If any one will not work , neither is he to eat . "
53 003 011	For we hear that some among you are leading disorderly lives , busy about nothing and yet busybodies .
53 003 012	Such we command and urge in the Lord Jesus Christ to work quietly and eat their own bread .
53 003 013	But you , brethren , must not become discouraged in doing well .
53 003 014	If any one does not obey our words in this letter , mark that man and do not associate with him , so that he may be ashamed .
53 003 015	Yet do not regard him as an enemy , but warn him as a brother .
53 003 016	The Lord of peace himself give you peace at all times in all ways . The Lord be with you all .
53 003 017	The greeting of Paul by my own hand , which is the sign in every letter . This is my handwriting .
53 003 018	The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with all of you .
54 001 001	PAUL , an apostle of Christ Jesus by the appointment of God , our Savior , and Christ Jesus our hope ,
54 001 002	to Timothy my true child in faith : Grace , mercy and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord .
54 001 003	As I begged you to stay in Ephesus when I was leaving for Macedonia , that you might charge some not to teach new and strange doctrines
54 001 004	nor give attention to myths and endless genealogies , which promote disputes rather than God's plan in the faith , so I beg you now .
54 001 005	The aim of the commandment is love out of a pure heart and a good conscience and a sincere faith .
54 001 006	Some missing these have turned aside to empty talk ,
54 001 007	wishing to be teachers of the Law , but not understanding either what they are saying or what the things are that they are so positive about .
54 001 008	We know that the Law is excellent , if any one uses it lawfully .

54 001 009	But we know this : that law is not laid down for a righteous man , but for the lawless and the insubordinate , the ungodly and sinners , the unholy and profane , for murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers , for manslayers ,
54 001 010	for the unchaste , for those who practice unnatural vices , for slave-dealers , liars , perjurers , and for whatever else is contrary to wholesome teaching
54 001 011	such as accords with the glorious good news of the blessed God , with which I have been entrusted .
54 001 012	I thank Christ Jesus our Lord who has given me strength , because he thought me faithful and put me into his service ,
54 001 013	though before that I spoke profanely and was a persecutor and insolent in outrages . But I received mercy because I did it ignorantly in unbelief .
54 001 014	And the grace of our Lord overflowed in me with faith and love in Christ Jesus .
54 001 015	The saying is trust-worthy and deserving of full acceptance that " Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners , " of whom I am the foremost .

54 001 016	But I received mercy for this reason , that in me , as the foremost , Jesus Christ might show all of his long-suffering for an example for those who are to believe in him and gain life eternal .
54 001 017	To the King of the ages , the immortal , invisible , only God , be honor and glory for the ages of the ages ! Amen .
54 001 018	This command I lay down for you , my child Timothy , in accordance with the prophecies that came in advance regarding you , in order that armed with them you may wage the noble war ,
54 001 019	holding to faith and a good conscience , which some have cast aside and thus made shipwreck of their faith .
54 001 020	Among these are Hymenaeus and Alexander , whom I have handed over to Satan , that they may learn not to speak profanely .
54 002 001	I BEG , then , first of all , that petitions , prayers , supplications , and thanksgivings be made in behalf of all men ,
54 002 002	in behalf of kings and all who are in authority , that we may lead a quiet and peaceful life in all piety and sobriety .
54 002 003	This is excellent and pleasing in the sight of God , our Savior ,
54 002 004	who wishes all men to be saved and to come to the knowledge of the truth .
54 002 005	For there is one God and one Mediator between God and men , himself man , Christ Jesus ,
54 002 006	who gave himself as a ransom for all , a fact to be witnessed to at the fitting time .
54 002 007	To this I was appointed a herald and an apostle — I am telling the truth , I am not lying — a teacher of Gentiles in faith and truth .
54 002 008	I wish , then , that the men offer prayer in every place , lifting up holy hands without wrath or debate .
54 002 009	Also that the women adorn themselves in becoming dress modestly and discreetly , not with braided hair or gold or pearls or costly clothes ,
54 002 010	but — as is becoming for women professing piety — with good deeds .
54 002 011	A woman is to learn in all subjection .
54 002 012	I do not permit a woman to teach or to usurp authority over a man , but she must remain silent .
54 002 013	Adam was first formed , then Eve .
54 002 014	And Adam was not deceived ; the woman was deceived and fell into sin .
54 002 015	But they will be saved through child-bearing , if they continue in faith and love and holiness with self-control .
54 003 001	THE saying is trustworthy : " If any one aspires to the office of a bishop , he desires a noble work . "
54 003 002	A bishop , then , should be above reproach , true to one woman , temperate , self-controlled , dignified , hospitable , with a gift for teaching ,
54 003 003	not given to wine or to blows , but fair-minded , averse to strife , not a lover of money ,
54 003 004	presiding well over his own house , with children obedient and respectful .
54 003 005	But if any one does not know how to preside over his own house , how will he take care of the church of God ?
54 003 006	He must not be a new convert , for fear he may be blinded by pride and fall into the condemnation of the Devil .
54 003 007	He must have a good reputation with outsiders so as not to fall into reproach and the snare of the Devil .
54 003 008	Deacons , in the same way , must be dignified , not double-tongued , not given to much wine , not eager for base gain ,
54 003 009	holding the mystery of the faith with a pure conscience .
54 003 010	They must first be tested , and then let them fill the office of deacon if there is nothing against them .
54 003 011	Women , in the same way , must be dignified , not slanderers , temperate , trustworthy in everything .
54 003 012	Deacons must be men true to one woman , presiding well over their children and their own houses .
54 003 013	Those who have filled the office of deacon well win for themselves a high standing and great boldness in the faith in Christ Jesus .
54 003 014	I am writing these things to you , although I hope to come to you soon ,
54 003 015	but so that if I am delayed you may know how people should conduct themselves in the household of God , which is the church of the living God , the pillar and base of the truth .

54 003 016	Confessedly great is the mystery of godliness : " Who was manifested in flesh , declared righteous in spirit , seen by angels , proclaimed among Gentiles , believed on in the world , received up in glory . "
54 004 001	THE Spirit says distinctly that in later times some will desert from the faith , giving attention to deceiving spirits and teachings of demons ,
54 004 002	through the hypocrisy of men who teach falsely , branded in their own consciences ,
54 004 003	forbidding marriage , and insisting on abstinence from certain kinds of food which God made to be partaken of with thanksgiving by those who are faithful and know the truth .
54 004 004	For everything made by God is excellent and nothing is to be rejected if taken with thanksgiving .
54 004 005	For it is made holy through God's message and through prayer .
54 004 006	In teaching this to the brethren you will be a noble servant of Christ Jesus , nourished by the words of the faith and of the excellent teaching which you have followed .
54 004 007	But avoid profane and old-womanish myths . Exercise yourself in godliness .
54 004 008	Bodily exercise is useful to a small degree , but godliness is useful for everything . " It has the promise of the present life and of the life that is to come . "
54 004 009	This saying is trustworthy and deserving of full acceptance .
54 004 010	For to this end we are laboring and wrestling , because we have set our hope on the living God , who is the Savior of all men , especially of believers .
54 004 011	Command and teach these things .
54 004 012	Let no one look down on you because you are young , but be an example to believers in speech , in the life you lead , in love , in faith , in purity .
54 004 013	Until I come give attention to reading , to exhortation , to teaching .
54 004 014	Do not neglect the gift that is in you , which was given to you through prophecy with the laying on of the hands of the eldership .
54 004 015	Be careful about these things , be fully occupied with them , that your progress may be plain to all .
54 004 016	Be thoughtful about yourself and your teaching . Persevere in this ; for in doing so you will save yourself and those who hear you .
54 005 001	Do not rebuke an older man , but entreat him as a father , the younger men as brothers ,
54 005 002	the older women as mothers and the younger women as sisters , in all purity .
54 005 003	Honor widows if they are really widows .

54 005 004	If any widow has children or grandchildren , let them learn first to act piously toward their own family and to repay what they owe to their parents and grandparents . For this is pleasing in the sight of God .
54 005 005	A real widow who is left alone has set her hope on God and devotes herself to prayers and supplications night and day .
54 005 006	But the pleasure-loving widow , though living , is already dead .
54 005 007	Give these commands that they may be free from reproach .
54 005 008	If any one does not provide for his own , and especially those of his own household , he has disowned the faith and is worse than an unbeliever .
54 005 009	A widow is to be put on the list if she has reached the age of not less than sixty years , if she has been true to one husband ,

54 005 010	has a reputation for good deeds , has brought up children , has entertained strangers , has washed the feet of the holy , has ministered to people in distress , has been active in every good work .
54 005 011	But younger widows refuse , for when wanton desires lead them away from Christ they wish to marry
54 005 012	and thus they incur condemnation for breaking their first promise .
54 005 013	At the same time they learn to be idle , going around from house to house , and not only idle , but gossips , and busybodies , saying what they should not .
54 005 014	I would , therefore , have the younger widows marry , bear children , keep house , give no occasion to our enemies for slander .
54 005 015	For already some have turned aside after Satan .
54 005 016	If any woman who is a believer has widows , she must provide for them and the church must not be burdened , so that it may provide for those who are really widows .
54 005 017	The elders who preside well should be thought worthy of double salary , especially those who labor in speaking and teaching .
54 005 018	For the Scripture says , " You shall not muzzle the ox while he is treading out the grain , " and the workman deserves his wages .
54 005 019	Against an elder do not receive an accusation unless on the testimony of two or three witnesses .
54 005 020	Those who are going on in sin rebuke before all , that the rest may fear .
54 005 021	I charge you before God and Christ Jesus and the chosen angels to observe these directions without prejudice , doing nothing through partiality .
54 005 022	Do not lay hands of ordination upon any one hastily . Have no share in the sins of other men . Keep yourself pure .
54 005 023	Do not keep on being a water-drinker , but use a little wine for the sake of your stomach and because of your frequent ailments .
54 005 024	Some men's sins are conspicuous and go on before to condemnation , but the sins of some men follow after them .
54 005 025	Just so noble deeds are conspicuous and those that are otherwise cannot be hid .
54 006 001	ALL who are slaves under the yoke must regard their own masters as worthy of all honor , so that the name of God and the teaching may not be profanely slandered .

54 006 002	Those who have believing masters must not despise them because they are brothers , but rather work as slaves for them because those who are benefited by their good work are believers and beloved . Teach and urge these things .
54 006 003	If any one teaches otherwise and does not agree to wholesome words , those of our Lord Jesus Christ , and to religious teaching ,
54 006 004	he is conceited , knowing nothing , but morbidly fond of disputes and controversies from which come envy , strife , abusive language , wicked suspicions ,
54 006 005	and wranglings of men of depraved minds who are destitute of the truth . They think of religion as a source of gain .
54 006 006	Religion with contentment is a great source of gain .
54 006 007	For we brought nothing into the world and we cannot carry anything out .
54 006 008	If we have food and clothing we will be content with these .
54 006 009	But those who are determined to be rich fall into temptation and a snare and many foolish and injurious passions which plunge men into destruction and ruin .
54 006 010	For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evil . Some men grasping for it have strayed from the faith and have pierced themselves with many pangs .
54 006 011	But you , O man of God , must shun this . Pursue righteousness , piety , faith , love , endurance , gentleness .
54 006 012	Play the grand hard game of the faith . Lay hold on life eternal , to which you have been called and have made the noble confession before many witnesses .
54 006 013	I charge you in the presence of God who gives life to all , and Christ Jesus who before Pontius Pilate made the noble confession ,
54 006 014	to keep the commandment stainless and free from reproach until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ ,
54 006 015	which in due time he will show , who is the blessed and only Potentate , the King of kings and Lord of lords ,
54 006 016	who alone has immortality , who dwells in light unapproachable , whom no man has seen or can see . To him be honor and power eternal ! Amen .
54 006 017	Command those who are rich in this world not to be haughty nor to fix their hope on uncertain wealth , but on God who provides all things richly for our enjoyment .
54 006 018	They must do good work , be rich in noble deeds , be generous , ready to share ,
54 006 019	treasuring up for themselves a good fund for the future , that they may lay hold on the life that is real .
54 006 020	O Timothy , guard what has been entrusted to you , turning away from profane and empty talk and contradictions of what is falsely called " knowledge . "
54 006 021	Some while professing it have gone astray as regards the faith . Grace be with you all .
55 001 001	PAUL , an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God according to the promise of life in Christ Jesus ,
55 001 002	to Timothy my beloved child : Grace , mercy , and peace from God the Father and from Christ Jesus our Lord .
55 001 003	I thank God whom , I serve , following in the steps of my forefathers , with a pure conscience , while I constantly mention you in my prayers night and day ,
55 001 004	remembering your tears and longing to see you , that I may be filled with joy .
55 001 005	I remember the sincere faith that is in you , which lived first in your grandmother Lois and then in your mother Eunice , and I am confident that it lives in you also .
55 001 006	For this reason let me remind you to kindle anew the gift of God that is in you by the laying on of my hands .
55 001 007	For God has not given us a spirit of fear , but of power and love and self-control .
55 001 008	Do not be ashamed to testify for our Lord or for me his prisoner , but join in suffering hardships for the good news as God gives power .
55 001 009	It is he who saved us and called us with a holy calling , not according to our deeds but according to his own purpose and grace , given to us in Christ Jesus ages ago
55 001 010	but now manifested by the appearance of our Savior Christ Jesus , who has defeated death and brought to light life and immortality by the good news .
55 001 011	For this I was made a herald and an apostle and a teacher ,

55 001 012	and for this reason I am suffering these things . But I am not ashamed , for I know in whom I have put my faith , and am confident that he is able to guard what I have entrusted to him until that day .
55 001 013	Hold to the example of wholesome words which you heard from me in faith and love in Christ Jesus .
55 001 014	Guard through the Holy Spirit which dwells in us the precious trust committed to you .
55 001 015	You know that all of those in Asia have deserted me . Among them are Phygelus and Hermogenes .
55 001 016	The Lord grant mercy to the family of Onesiphorus , for he often cheered me and was not ashamed of my chain ;
55 001 017	but when he came to Rome he looked me up eagerly and found me .
55 001 018	The Lord grant to him to find mercy from the Lord on that day ! And in how many ways he served me in Ephesus you know better still .
55 002 001	YOU , therefore , my child , must be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus ,
55 002 002	and the things you heard from me , which came through many witnesses , you must commit to trustworthy men who will be able to teach others also .
55 002 003	Take your share of hardship as a good soldier of Christ Jesus .
55 002 004	No one while serving as a soldier entangles himself in the affairs of life , for the soldier must please him who enlisted him .
55 002 005	And if any one enters an athletic contest , he is not crowned unless he competes according to the rules .
55 002 006	The farmer who does the labor ought first to have his share of the fruits .
55 002 007	Think over what I am saying , for the Lord will give you insight in all things .
55 002 008	Remember Jesus Christ , raised from the dead , a descendant of David , as my good news teaches .
55 002 009	In telling it I am suffering hardships even to chains , as if I were an evildoer , but God's message is not chained .
55 002 010	For this reason I am enduring all for the sake of the chosen , that they may gain the salvation that is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory .
55 002 011	Trustworthy is the saying , " For if we have died with him we shall also live with him ;
55 002 012	if we endure we shall also be kings with him ; if we disown him , he will disown us ;
55 002 013	if we are faithless , he remains faithful ; for he cannot disown himself . "
55 002 014	Remind them of these things , charging them before God not to engage in controversy to no profit , but to the ruin of the hearers .
55 002 015	Be earnest in presenting yourself to God as a tested man , a workman who has no cause to be ashamed , rightly handling the message of truth .
55 002 016	But shun profane and empty talk . It will grow into greater impiety ,
55 002 017	and its teachings will spread like a gangrene . Hymenaeus and Philetus are of this sort .
55 002 018	They have gone astray as to the truth , saying that the resurrection has already taken place , and they are overthrowing the faith of some .
55 002 019	However , God's solid foundation stands , with this inscription , " The Lord knows his own , " and , " Let every one who names the Lord's name turn from wickedness . "
55 002 020	In a great house there are not only utensils of gold and silver , but also of wood and earthenware , and some are for honorable and others for dishonorable uses .
55 002 021	If any one keeps himself pure from these errors , he will be ready for honorable use , holy , fit for the master's service , prepared for every good work .
55 002 022	But flee the passions of youth and pursue righteousness , faith , love , peace , in the company of those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart .
55 002 023	Avoid foolish disputes of the uneducated , knowing that they give rise to quarrels ,
55 002 024	and the servant of the Lord must not quarrel , but be courteous to all , skillful in teaching , forbearing ,
55 002 025	instructing opponents with gentleness , for God may give them a change of heart which will lead them to knowledge of the truth ,
55 002 026	and they may return to soberness and escape the snare of the Devil when captured by the Lord's servant to do the Lord's will .
55 003 001	I WOULD have you know this , that in the last days trying times will come ;
55 003 002	for people will be lovers of self , lovers of money , boasters , haughty , abusive , disobedient to parents , ungrateful , profane ,
55 003 003	without family affection , relentless , slanderers , without self-control , brutal , haters of good ,
55 003 004	treacherous , reckless , conceited , lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God .
55 003 005	They will have a form of religion , but will cast off its power . Avoid such people .
55 003 006	For of this class are those who make their way into houses and take captive weak women loaded with sins , led by varying passions ,
55 003 007	always learning and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth .
55 003 008	Just as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses , so these men oppose the truth , depraved in mind , proved to be worthless as regards the faith .
55 003 009	But they will go no further , for their folly will be manifest to all as that of Jannes and Jambres became .
55 003 010	But you have kept track of my teaching , my course of life , my purpose , my faith , my slowness to anger , my love , my patience ,
55 003 011	my persecutions , my sufferings — what happened to me at Antioch , Iconium , Lystra , what persecutions I underwent . But the Lord delivered me out of all of them .
55 003 012	And all who are determined to live religiously in Christ Jesus will be persecuted .
55 003 013	Wicked men and impostors will go on from bad to worse , deceiving and being deceived .
55 003 014	But you must stand by what you learned and were persuaded of , knowing from whom you learned it
55 003 015	and that from childhood you have known the sacred writings which can give you wisdom to gain salvation through faith in Christ Jesus .
55 003 016	All Scripture is divinely inspired and is useful for teaching , for proof , for correction of error , for education in righteousness ,
55 003 017	that the man of God may be complete , equipped for every good work .
55 004 001	I CHARGE you before God and Christ Jesus , who will soon judge the living and the dead , and by his appearing and his kingdom :
55 004 002	proclaim the message , be at it in season and out of season , convince , rebuke , encourage , with all patience in teaching .
55 004 003	For there will be a time when they will not endure wholesome teaching , but following their own fancies and wishing to have their ears tickled , they will get a crowd of teachers .
55 004 004	They will turn their ears away from the truth and give attention to myths .
55 004 005	But you must be calm in all circumstances , suffer hardships , do the work of a bringer of the good news , carry out fully all the duties of your office .
55 004 006	For I am already being poured out like a drink offering , and the time of my departure is near .
55 004 007	I have played the grand hard game , I have finished my race , I have kept the faith .
55 004 008	Now the crown of righteousness is awaiting me . The Lord the righteous judge will give it to me on that day , and not only to me but to all those who have loved his appearing .
55 004 009	Make haste to come to me quickly .
55 004 010	For Demas deserted me because he loved the present world and has gone to Thessalonica . Crescens has gone to Galatia , Titus to Dalmatia .
55 004 011	Luke alone is with me . Get Mark and bring him with you , for he is useful to me in service .
55 004 012	I sent Tychicus to Ephesus .
55 004 013	When you come , bring the cloak that I left at Troas with Carpus , and the books , and particularly the parchments .
55 004 014	Alexander the coppersmith showed much ill will toward me . The Lord will repay him according to his deeds .
55 004 015	Be on your guard against him , for he strongly opposed our teachings .
55 004 016	At my first defense no one came to my help ; all deserted me . May it not be laid up against them !
55 004 017	But the Lord stood by me and strengthened me so that through me the proclamation might be fully published and all the Gentiles might hear it , and I was saved from the mouth of the lion .
55 004 018	The Lord will rescue me from every wicked attack and will keep me safe for his heavenly kingdom . To him be glory for the ages of the ages ! Amen .
55 004 019	Give my greetings to Prises and Aquila and the household of Onesiphorus .
55 004 020	Erastus stayed at Corinth . Trophimus I left at Miletus , sick .
55 004 021	Try to come before winter . Eubulus and Pudens and Linus and Claudia and all the brethren send their greetings to you .
55 004 022	The Lord be with your spirit . Grace be with you all .
56 001 001	PAUL , a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ to promote the faith of God's chosen and their knowledge of the truths of religion ,
56 001 002	in hope of life eternal , which the God who never lies promised ages ago
56 001 003	but in due time made known as his message through the proclamation with which I was entrusted by the commission of God our Savior ,
56 001 004	to Titus my true child in our common faith : Grace and peace from God the Father , and from Christ Jesus , our Savior .
56 001 005	For this reason I left you in Crete : to arrange the things that are lacking and appoint elders in every city as I directed you ,
56 001 006	wherever there is a man of irreproachable character , true to one woman , with believing children who are not charged with dissolute conduct and not unruly .
56 001 007	For a bishop , as God's steward , must be above reproach , not self-willed , not quick-tempered , not given to wine , not given to blows , not eager for base gain ,
56 001 008	but hospitable , a lover of good , self-controlled , just , holy , temperate ,
56 001 009	holding to the trustworthy message which is according to the teaching , so that he may be able also to encourage others by wholesome teaching and to refute opposers .
56 001 010	For there are many insubordinate persons , foolish talkers and deceivers , especially those who are of the circumcision ,
56 001 011	who ought to be silenced , for they are upsetting whole house-holds , teaching what they should not , merely for the sake of base gain .
56 001 012	One of themselves , a prophet of their own , said , " Cretans are always liars , base brutes , lazy gluttons . "
56 001 013	This testimony is true . For this reason rebuke them sharply , that they may be sound in the faith ,
56 001 014	not giving attention to Jewish myths and rules laid down by men who are turning away from the truth .
56 001 015	To the pure all things are pure ; but to the polluted and unbelieving nothing is pure . Even their minds and consciences are polluted .
56 001 016	They profess to know God , but by their deeds they disown him . They are detestable , disobedient , and worthless for any good work .
56 002 001	YOU must speak to them of the matters which should have a place in wholesome teaching .
56 002 002	Tell the older men to be temperate , dignified , self-controlled , sound in faith , in love , in patience .
56 002 003	Tell the older women , in the same way , to be reverent in behavior , not slanderers , not enslaved to much wine , teachers of what is noble ,
56 002 004	that they may train the young women to be loving wives and loving mothers ,
56 002 005	self-controlled , pure , home-workers , kind , submissive to their own husbands , that God's message may not be slandered .
56 002 006	Urge the younger men , in the same way , to practice self-control in everything .
56 002 007	Make yourself an example of good works , sincerity in teaching , dignified behavior
56 002 008	and wholesome talk that is above censure , that our opponents may be ashamed , having nothing evil to say about us .
56 002 009	Tell slaves to be submissive to their own masters in all things and to try to please them , not answering back ,
56 002 010	not pilfering , but showing all kindly fidelity , so as to make the teaching about God our Savior seem beautiful in all respects .
56 002 011	For the grace of God has appeared bringing salvation to all men ,
56 002 012	teaching us to renounce all irreligion and worldly passions and to live soberly , justly and piously in this present world ,
56 002 013	waiting for the blessed hope , the glorious appearing of the great God and of our Savior Christ Jesus ,
56 002 014	who gave himself for us to redeem us from all sin and purify us as his own people earnest in honorable work .
56 002 015	Tell them these things , urge , convince with all authority ; let no one slight you .
56 003 001	REMIND them to be submissive to ruling authorities , to be obedient , to be ready for every good work ,
56 003 002	to speak abusively to no one , to be peaceable , to be fair , showing all gentleness toward all men .
56 003 003	For we ourselves were once thoughtless , disobedient , astray , enslaved to passions and various pleasures , living in malice and envy , hateful and hating one another .
56 003 004	But when the kindness of our Savior , God , and his love to men appeared ,
56 003 005	" not because of works that we had done in righteousness , but out of his own mercy he saved us through the bath of the new birth and the renewing of the Holy Spirit
56 003 006	which he poured out upon us richly through Jesus Christ our Savior ,
56 003 007	that we might be declared righteous by his grace and become heirs with the hope of life eternal . "

56 003 008	That is a trustworthy saying . I wish you to insist on these things so that those who have put their faith in God may give earnest attention to honorable work . These things are honorable and also useful to men .
56 003 009	But avoid foolish disputes and genealogies and strife and quarrels about the Law ; for they are unprofitable and futile .
56 003 010	If a man is factious , after one or two warnings , have nothing more to do with him ,
56 003 011	knowing that such a one is perverted and goes on sinning though self-condemned .
56 003 012	When I send Artemas to you or Tychicus , try to come to me at Nicopolis , for I have decided to pass the winter there .
56 003 013	Do your best in helping Zenas , the lawyer , and Apollos forward on their journey so that they may lack nothing .
56 003 014	Our people too must learn to give attention to honorable work , so as to be able to meet pressing needs , that they may not be fruitless .
56 003 015	All who are with me send you their greetings . Give our greetings to those who love us in the faith . Grace be with all of you .
57 001 001	PAUL , a prisoner of Christ Jesus , and Timothy our brother , to Philemon , our beloved fellow worker ,
57 001 002	and to Apphia , our sister , and to Archippus , our fellow soldier , and to the Church that meets at your house :
57 001 003	Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ .
57 001 004	I always thank my God when I mention you in my prayers ,
57 001 005	for I hear of the love and the loyalty that you have to the Lord Jesus Christ and to all the holy .
57 001 006	I pray that your fellowship in the faith may become effective in the knowledge of all the good there is in us in our relation to Christ .
57 001 007	For I have had great joy and encouragement in your love , because the hearts of the holy have been refreshed by you , brother .
57 001 008	Therefore , though I might have great boldness in Christ to command you what is fitting ,
57 001 009	I beg you rather for love's sake , as Paul the old man and now the prisoner of Christ Jesus —
57 001 010	I beg you in behalf of my child Onesimus , born to me in my chains ,
57 001 011	who once was useless to you , but now is useful to you and to me .
57 001 012	I am sending him back to you , though he is my very heart .
57 001 013	I should like to have him for my own , to serve me in my chains for the good news , as your representative ,
57 001 014	but without your consent I am unwilling to do anything , so that your goodness may not be of necessity but of free will .
57 001 015	Perhaps it was for this that he was separated from you for a time , that you might have him back for ever ,
57 001 016	no longer as a slave , but more than a slave , a brother beloved , especially to me , but how much more to you , both in the flesh and in the Lord .
57 001 017	If then you hold me for a partner , receive him as you would me .
57 001 018	If he has wronged you in any way or owes you anything , charge that to my account .
57 001 019	I , Paul , write it with my own hand . I will pay it — not to mention to you that you owe me your own self besides .
57 001 020	Yes , brother , let me have this help from you in the Lord ; refresh my heart in Christ .
57 001 021	I am writing to you confident of your obedience and knowing that you will do more than I say .
57 001 022	At the same time I want you to prepare a lodging for me , for I hope that through your prayers I shall be given back to you .
57 001 023	Epaphras , my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus ,
57 001 024	and Mark , Aristarchus , Demas and Luke , my fellow workers , send you their greetings .
57 001 025	The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirits .
58 001 001	MANY times and in many ways God spoke of old to our fathers by the prophets ;
58 001 002	but at the end of these days he has spoken to us by a Son , whom he has appointed heir of all things and through whom he made the world ,

58 001 003	who is the reflection of his glory and the expression of his nature and sustains all things by his word of power , and who , when he had made purification from sins , took his seat at the right hand of the Majesty on high ,
58 001 004	having become as much superior to the angels as the name he has inherited surpasses theirs .
58 001 005	For to which of the angels did he ever say , " Thou art my son ; I have to-day become thy Father " ? and again , " I will be to him a Father and he shall be to me a Son " ?
58 001 006	And again when he brings his first-born into the world of men he says , " And let all the angels of God bow down to him . "
58 001 007	Referring to the angels he says , " He makes his angels winds , his servants a flame of fire . "
58 001 008	But regarding the Son he says , " Thy throne , O God , is forever and ever . Thy royal scepter is a scepter of justice .
58 001 009	Thou lovest righteousness and hatest lawlessness , therefore God , thy God , has anointed thee with the oil of gladness beyond thy companions . "
58 001 010	And , " Thou , in the beginning , O Lord , didst found the earth , and the heavens are works of thy hands .
58 001 011	They will perish , but thou wilt endure . They all will grow old like a garment
58 001 012	and like a mantle thou wilt roll them up . But thou art the same and thy years will never end . "
58 001 013	To which of the angels did he ever say , " Sit at my right hand till I make thine enemies thy footstool " ?
58 001 014	Are they not all ministering spirits sent forth for service in behalf of those who are to inherit salvation ?
58 002 001	FOR this reason we should give special attention to the things that we have heard , so as not to drift away from them .
58 002 002	For if the message spoken through angels was sure and every violation and disobedience received merited punishment ,
58 002 003	how shall we escape if we neglect so great a salvation , which at the beginning was spoken by the Lord and was confirmed to us by those who heard him ,
58 002 004	while God added his testimony by signs and wonders and many kinds of miracles and impartation of the Holy Spirit according to his will ?
58 002 005	For he has not subjected to angels the coming world of which we speak .
58 002 006	But somewhere one says , " What is man that thou rememberest him ? Or the son of man that thou carest for him ?
58 002 007	Thou hast made him a little lower than the angels . With glory and honor thou hast crowned him .
58 002 008	All things thou hast put under his feet . " When he put all things under him he left nothing that was not put under him . We do not yet see all things put under him ,

58 002 009	but we see Jesus , who was made a little lower than the angels for the suffering of death that by the grace of God he might taste of death for every man , now crowned with glory and honor .

58 002 010	For it was fitting that he through whom are all things and for whom are all things , when leading many sons to glory , should make the great Leader of their salvation perfect through sufferings .
58 002 011	For he who makes holy and they who are made holy are all of one . For this cause he is not ashamed to call them brothers ,
58 002 012	saying , " I will tell thy name to my brothers . In the midst of the assembly I will sing praise to thee , "
58 002 013	and again , " I will trust in him , " and again , " Here am I and the children whom God has given me . "

58 002 014	Since then the children share in blood and flesh , he himself in the same way shared in them , in order that through death he might defeat him who had the power of death , that is , the Devil ,
58 002 015	and set free all those who through fear of death were all their lives doomed to slavery .
58 002 016	For he does not come to the help of angels , but he comes to the help of the descendants of Abraham .

58 002 017	And for that reason he had to be made like his brethren in everything , so as to be a compassionate and faithful high priest in things relating to God , to make propitiation for the sins of the people .
58 002 018	For since he himself has suffered when tempted he is able to help those who are tempted .
58 003 001	THEREFORE , holy brethren , sharers in a heavenly call , consider the Apostle and High Priest of our confession , Jesus ,
58 003 002	who was faithful to him who made him as also Moses was in all God's house .
58 003 003	For he has been thought worthy of more glory than Moses , just as he who has built a house has more honor than the house .
58 003 004	For every house is built by some one , but he who built all things is God .
58 003 005	Moses was faithful in all God's house as a servant for a testimony to the things that were to be spoken ,
58 003 006	but Christ as a Son over his own house . We are his house if we hold firmly to the end our confidence and the hope of which we boast .
58 003 007	Wherefore , as the Holy Spirit says , " To-day if you will hear his voice ,
58 003 008	do not harden your hearts as when they made me angry on the day when they tried me in the desert ,
58 003 009	when your fathers put me to a test and saw my deeds for forty years .
58 003 010	Therefore I was much displeased with that generation and said , ' They always go astray in their hearts and they do not know my paths . '
58 003 011	So I swore in my wrath , ' They shall not enter into my rest . '
58 003 012	See to it , brethren , that there shall not be in any one of you a wicked , unbelieving heart ready to forsake the living God ,
58 003 013	but encourage one another daily while it is called " to-day , " that no one may be hardened by the deceitfulness of sin .
58 003 014	For we become sharers with Christ if we hold firmly to the end the assurance with which we began .
58 003 015	When it is said , " To-day if you will hear his voice , do not harden your hearts as when they made me angry " —
58 003 016	who when they heard made him angry ? Was it not all those who came out of Egypt with Moses ?
58 003 017	With whom was he much displeased for forty years ? Was it not with those who sinned , whose bodies fell in the desert ?
58 003 018	To whom did he swear that they should not enter his rest , except to those who had no faith ?
58 003 019	We see that they were unable to enter because of their lack of faith .
58 004 001	LET us , then , be afraid that , though the promise of entering his rest is still left , some one of you may seem to have missed it .
58 004 002	For we have received the good news just as they did , but the message that was heard did not benefit them , since it did not meet with faith in the hearers .

58 004 003	For we who have faith are entering into the rest , as he said , " As I swore in my wrath , ' They shall not enter into my rest , ' " although his works had been finished since the creation of the world .
58 004 004	For he has somewhere spoken of the seventh day thus , " And God rested on the seventh day from all his works , "
58 004 005	and in this place again , " They shall not enter into my rest . "
58 004 006	Since , then , it remains for some to enter into it , and those who first received the good news did not enter because of lack of faith —
58 004 007	again he indicates a day , " to-day , " saying in David so long after , as has been already quoted , " To-day if you will hear his voice , do not harden your hearts . "
58 004 008	For if Joshua had given them rest he would not be speaking of another day after that .
58 004 009	Therefore there still remains a rest for the people of God .
58 004 010	For he who has entered into God's rest has rested from his works as God did from his .
58 004 011	Let us endeavor then to enter into that rest so that no one shall fall , after that example of lack of faith .

58 004 012	For the word of God is living and effective and sharper than any two-edged sword , and it pierces until it divides soul and spirit , joints and marrow , and it judges the thoughts and purposes of the heart .
58 004 013	There is not a creature invisible to him , but all things are naked and defenseless before the eyes of him to whom we must account .
58 004 014	Since , then , we have a great High Priest who has passed through the heavens , Jesus , the Son of God , let us hold fast our confession .
58 004 015	For we have not a high priest who cannot sympathize with our weaknesses , for he has been tempted in every way just as we are , yet without sin .
58 004 016	Therefore let us come with confidence to the throne of grace and receive compassion and find grace for timely help .
58 005 001	FOR every high priest taken from among men is appointed in behalf of men in things relating to God to offer gifts and sacrifices for sins .
58 005 002	He is able to sympathize with the ignorant and the erring , since he himself is beset with weaknesses .
58 005 003	For this reason he must bring an offering for his own sins , just as he does for those of the people .
58 005 004	And no one takes this honor upon himself unless called by God , as Aaron was .
58 005 005	So too Christ did not take for himself the glory of becoming a high priest , but he who said to him , " Thou art my Son , to-day I have become thy Father , "
58 005 006	and who says in another place , " Thou art a priest forever after the order of Melchizedek . "

58 005 007	Christ , in the days of his flesh , offered prayers and supplications to him who was able to save him from death , with strong outcries and tears , and was heard and saved from his terrors .
58 005 008	Although he was a Son he learned obedience from his sufferings ,
58 005 009	and being thus made perfect he became the author of eternal salvation to all who obey him ,
58 005 010	and was proclaimed by God a high priest after the order of Melchizedek .
58 005 011	Regarding Melchizedek we have much to say that is hard to explain , since you have become dull of hearing .

58 005 012	For when , considering the time , you ought to be teachers you need to have some one teach you again the first principles of the revelations of God . You have come to need milk and not solid food .

58 011 001	FAITH is an assurance of things hoped for , a conviction of things not seen .
58 011 002	By this the men of old won their fame .
